title: not what you're looking for...
text:
I am not what you're looking for; you never imagined my existence.
I seem normal-ish; know how to fit in, how to be invisible, how to turn on charm to hold court, how to wear the professional masque, how to have fun, how to disappear.

I have a sense of style.
I'm not always this cold.
It takes patience to get to know me. 
But I'm not "high-maintenance"

I like smart... too smart... the kind that never meets its match
I like clean
I like sensitive
I like beautiful
I like sweetness
I like playful

I have a penchant for the exotic, for aquiline profiles, for jazz-punk, unexpected plot twists, for meticulously planned hours and, spontaneous long voyages.

I need honourable
I need honest
I need to be seen and heard
I need mutual respect

Some kind of activity makes for a good ice-breaker:
I like live music- for deep listening, or dancing, or both
I like the beauty of wilderness, which is never pristine even if it is virginal
I like the beauty and the curious in this synthesized world of culture and art as well; I can walk around all day looking at paintings as easily as looking at trees or slugs or rocks.
I'm particular about films, and theatre, and literature; love it or hate it, it makes for a discussion springboard.

I'm not much of a drinker
I don't get sports
I hate shopping

If this sounds like it's all about me, it's because I have no idea, to whom I am speaking.
I can't show what a good listener I can be, until you say something.

title: Attentive Attention
text:
I am a husband and father who enjoys receiving massage. I admire and value the sacred space created by practitioners, to heal the body and quiet the mind. Bodywork has proven integral to my well being, as both a pleasant and practical form of facilitated meditation.

But a massage isn't something I can afford to have often. So, instead of paying to feel this way, I'd rather massage others for free. Performing bodywork lets me repay the patience, generosity, and attention that I received on the table. Moreover, I gain a very different sense of myself, which is truly a gift all its own.

My offer is simple, straight forward, and easy to attain: have a body that you want massaged. We'll coordinate schedules, then meet once, or regularly. My intention is to heal, connect with, and relieve your physical body.

I am a professional Black male, in my late thirties, of average weight and height. My personality type (ENTP) emphasizes thinking over feeling, which explains this lengthy post and my pursuit of sensate connections. My wife understands me best of course, and is my rock in this endeavor. She recognizes my need to be used, tasked, and encouraged by women. Through this ad, she is allowing you to do just that.

I've offered my time and attention via Craigslist in the past, and may provide references - if not, testimonials. I'm available for 1 to 3 hour sessions, most evenings, weekends, and Fridays. You can visit my modest Berkeley studio, or I can travel to you, within 30 minutes of Lake Merritt. I own a portable table, use draping, and have been privileged to work with various body types, abilities and conditions.

Please note that I am merely a student of touch, with no formal training. If you have any relevant ailments or medically diagnosed concerns, you are strongly advised to inform me. I can research and prepare, but ultimately trust that you know your health best. Above all else, I encourage feedback, and will dutifully adjust my stroke for your comfort.

My style is an intuitive mix of Swedish, Esalen, Lomi Lomi, and Thai stretches. I'm also familiar with the sacrum, psoas, glutes, adductors, and some lymph systems. You're welcome to inquire about your preferred modality as well - learning them expands my capacity to serve. Whatever the request or preference, I aim to deliver what you need to relax.

I welcome all inquiries. The most common one asks why I do this for free. While there is no fee, your presence and attention are invaluable. Caring for others helps me focus, open up emotionally, and simply be grateful. Giving is a chance to be present, which allows me to see my own patterns and solve my own problems, more easily. Not only is money a hurdle to having these moments, it often diminishes their value.

I hope to have written enough that you might respond with the same confidence, good faith and gratitude that I've attempted to display. Should you reply, please include a reasonable introduction, and what you can about your unique massage goals, needs, and/or concerns. Simply include your photo if you would like mine, in kind. Otherwise, expect to voice verify or meet and greet before booking. Finally, title your response "somatic healing", so I might weed out spam.

Thank you for reading all of this through. Be well!

title: WOMAN ON SPIRITUAL HEART PATH SEEKS NEW FRIENDS
text:
LOOKING FOR NEW FRIENDS in the Northbay. I just moved to Santa Rosa from the Eastbay-- If this all resonates with you, please write me. Blessings to all to find the friends that are best for you.

I'd love to meet people that deeply mirror enough of my path and stages of growth so we can easily understand each other, feel compassion and provide support for each other. I'm new to the SF Northbay, I have a couple friends in the Eastbay but would like friends here to share my life stories and growth and listen to your life stories and growth. I'm looking for someone similar to me---already on a spiritual heart path. I'm a regular type person yet born heart-evolved, young at heart, a Lightworker, age 60, attractive, about to begin another part of my journey, the main portion of my Divine Life Purpose work. Desire someone to share life experiences, ups and downs, on our ongoing growth paths, with compassionate healing focuses on all levels-- mental emotional physical spiritual financial but mostly like to keep things simple, and focused on the heart, with deep self compassion and compassion for others. 

I am currently preparing to do a variety of work to create a financial foundation, dogwalking, groceryshopping, while I prepare to become an Angel Therapist (helping others connect to their Angels for healing all parts of their life). I do embrace basic spiritual laws like Ask & you will receive, and pay attention to your own beliefs to find blockages to receiving,etc but I mostly keep a grounded and honest focus, although I am basically an optimist with faith I also have a simple discerning tool that regularly sees red flags in myself and life so I can help heal or release things. Also I use basic humanistic psychology to see relationship dynamics needing to be healed in the world, with others and within oneself, often originating from one's childhood family issues, etc. My view of the world is that we are all blessed by the Divine and all have access to the Divine, and we all are receiving Divine assistance to bring thru healing for humanity and the earth, one person at a time, based on freewill choices. 

I'm also aware of the Sonoma State University archives of Project Censored, and the corporate greed going on. But mostly I just like to focus on creating a simple, grounded, compassionate life for myself and close friends. And would love to have someone to go with to the park and the river, and maybe some other event we could enjoy together. I'm becoming a vegetarian soon, and I'm trying to get in shape by simple stretching, but don't do any intense strenuous activity, although I used to dance and will be doing so again. 

I am a basically compassionate person and don't harm others, and need a friend who is similar, I am not judgemental but I am getting very clear about what type of support is nourishing for me. I need a little head but a lot of heart too. I'm not very emotional exactly, but I can be passionate about social justice issues, and when my heart is open I can cry in empathy with tears. Looking for a friend in the same ballpark, so we can support each other, but also have access to our own intuitive guidance and listen to our own inner wisdom and bodywisdom. So we don't need to do much of anything but be compassionate witnesses for each other, and just both of us share and both of us listen. I'm planning on following Christiane Northrup book, Goddesses Never Age. 

Although I've been on a spiritual path, my childhood background has been to come from a more traditional background, so I had to work hard to release beliefs that interfered with my desired process, so in that way my orientation still reflects a much more grounded approach to all my work, simple, kind, loving, open, transparent, is how I approach the work and myself, so I still sometimes struggle as I'm creating a solid and fully self-loving perspective that will be perfect for me, healthy and grounded. I believe that many teachers don't realize how much they use anti-human language that disconnects them from their own feelings, authentic process, and natural comfort zone and body wisdom. I like to keep my path, my work, and my perspectives very simple and very grounded and very human oriented. If this all resonates with you simply and deeply, please write me. Looking forward to meeting you.

title: ​Gay guy looking for straight/mostly straight guy for friends/chat
text:
I'm a gay guy looking to get over some long-standing hangups I have about straight men and emotional intimacy between men.

I'm 32. I grew up in the midwest. I think I'm generally pretty well-adjusted. I've been with my boyfriend for 7 years and we've got a healthy, honest, and communicative relationship. Despite being comfortable with myself and who I am, I have difficulty forming close friendships with straight men. I tend to avoid being too nice or getting too close out of fear that I'll cross some boundary, make them uncomfortable, or generally that it'd be inappropriate in some way.

I want to be more comfortable being myself around straight men, expressing affection, etc. I'm not sure exactly what I'm looking for, but some options:

- Someone to chat with about this stuff. Email, chat, phone or whatever.
- A guy I could talk frankly about sex with (straight sex and gay sex)
- A guy I could be casually physically affectionate with the way I am with women and other gay men.
​- A friend to hang out with, play video games, hike/backpack, watch movies with.

Hopefully this would be helpful for both of us. I'm sure there are lots of guys primarily interested in sex with women who still have hangups about male intimacy and caring, or bi-curious guys who'd like to talk things out.

Not to be too negative, but I'm NOT looking for gay guys who are closeted, guys who fetishize straightness, or guys who are only looking for sex. No offense, just not what I'm looking for.

To wrap up, this is pretty personal stuff for me. I'm kind of nervous about putting this out there, and I'm not sure if I even want to follow through. I'd probably want to email a bit before meeting up, if I even felt comfortable meeting at all. Thanks for understanding.

title: Married, once married or in a LTR with a woman
text:
If you're a married man (or once were) or if you're in a long-term relationship with a woman and you'd like a discreet place to discuss your sexuality and form genuine friendships with similar men, please check out the "Married/Once Married Men's Group" that meets weekly at the Pacific Center in Berkeley. It's the only group of its type that meets in the Bay Area.

Although the group is primarily platonic, there have been times in the past when a long-term romance has developed between two members.

One thing the group is NOT is a place to find hook-up partners.

The group is anonymous and the confidentiality of all participants is protected. Current "regulars" range in age from 28 - 68 and the average number of attendees each week is nine. Meetings are every Wednesday night, from 8pm - 9:50pm. The Pacific Center is located at 2712 Telegraph Avenue in Berkeley.

I started attending more than three years ago when I was looking for feedback on coming out to my teenage kids. I didn't expect to attend more than once, but because the guys' feedback was so helpful, I returned to tell them how it went. I've been hooked ever since. I've found my tribe - there's no other social group like it. The dynamic is neither straight nor gay, it's somewhere in between.

I'm posting this information, not because the group needs more participants, but because it's a unique resource that hundreds of men have found invaluable throughout the group's 30+ year history.

title: "Ditch vision"
text:
Hello,

I'm bookish, a reader and thinker. I write stuff but not in an ego-driven, look-at-me way. I typically come across as quiet. I'm more frequently a pedestrian than a driver, go to libraries more often than bookstores. But I'm not seeking someone identical to myself.

"Ditch vision" is apparently a term coined by an obscure poet (Jeremy Hooker) to refer to the predisposition to seek the miraculous and wondrous in small, mundane things. I identify with that. I guess I'm a practitioner of what you might call "the new parochialism," seeking transcendence (to be transported) here at home, by what's local and specific -- within arm's reach or walking distance.

Anyway, I enjoy walking (wandering on foot), poetic reverie, philosophizing, reading out loud, and so forth. I also enjoy throwing a frisbee in a peaceful way; tennis too, possibly, though honestly it's been a while. And I run (jog) to keep fit.

If you enjoy any of the above, feel free to send me a message. Thanks.

title: Craigslist, Caddishness, and Confessions
text:
First, let's agree to dispense with any pretense that you and I are seeking something purely platonic. The Strictly Platonic category is nothing more than a psychological neutral zone where we can each find a modicum of comfort in using Craigslist as a cyber-conduit. Besides, this particular category provides plausible deniability when romantic gestures are rebuked for whatever reason. We each know that platonic relationships between men and women are reserved for in-laws, colleagues at the office, and parents of your child's playmates, which in themselves have the ability to become entangled. Let's simply be honest with our purpose for using CL's Platonic section and we can move forward in liberating transparency. 

Craigslist offers a brilliant opportunity to embellish all that I have to offer a woman. It's the perfect platform to exaggerate everything that is me and no one will know the depths of fiction I descend into for the sake of anonymous replies. If one takes a moment to consider how easy it is to conjure up an idealized portrait of oneself, it's as wonderfully beautiful as it is alarming. With that in mind, I beg your indulgence as I describe more about me and offer you confessions of a Craigslist man.

I suppose it's only natural to initially get the physical description out front. Sure, I could attach a photo to this ad but that would be at clear odds with my actual physical characteristics. Stating that I'm 6'01" and 178 lb. may cause considerable confusion and consternation when we meet at the prearranged time at Starbucks for our meet-and-greet. Of course, by the time we introduce one another, I suspect that I will have enchanted you with my charm, wit, and head-spinning knowledge of the socio-economic conditions within the Czech Republic that you will be blind to my 5'03" and 327 lb. frame. I fully anticipate, after the initial shock wears off, that you will agree that I carry my weight exceptionally well. After the first few minutes, I confidently submit that you will not even notice which limb I have missing, my eyepatch will become less conspicuous, and my needed oxygen tube and accompanying tank will disappear as you listen with rapt attention as I drone on and on about my life. We will undoubtedly become lost in stories about myself as we sip our caramel macchiatos and pick at that wonderful Starbucks iced lemon pound cake that I insisted you purchase for us to share.

And yes, my conversation skills are limited to only things about me. Contrary to my correspondence that seemingly had me interested in you as a person, which eventually led to the Starbucks rendezvous, I will sit and self-obsessively regale you with story after story about my life, politics, failed past relationships, disagreeable personalities at work, interests, and experiences. After all, if I were to ask you anything about yourself so that I may know you better, it would unnecessarily take time away from my soliloquy concerning all things about me. As a Craigslist man, I find myself endlessly fascinating and only wish to share everything about me - however greatly exaggerated those details will be -at the expense of knowing anything about you. It's not as though my self-indulgence is a crutch used to mask my fragile ego and personality pathologies, so please forgo the temptation to employ any dime-store psychology. 

Casting a wide net is extremely important when looking for responses to a Craigslist ad. Appealing to the more shallow and superficial of women who will read this is part of my task. First, I cut and paste a photo of a car that I disingenuously claim is mine. My experience has proven that German manufactured automobiles tend to be the most well received. Thanks to Photoshop, I send off a picture of me standing next to "my" 2014 7-Series BMW. Again, the purpose for the deception is to acquire the proper interest needed to secure the first date at Starbucks. By the time the macchiatos are sipped to the bottom of our venti cups, there will be no chance that you will refuse to push my rusted 1973 Datsun so to help engage the starter as I drive off with white smoke belching from the broken exhaust pipe. 

Understandably, the condition and location of my residence is always of interest. Once again, I enlist the tool for easy deception - Photoshop. The picture of me standing proudly in my billiard room works perfectly. After all, if I'm well-to-do enough to have a billiard room, the reader's imagination will be swirling with calculations of the square footage that surrounds me. (I used to send out a photo of me enjoying a cocktail and lounging next to "my" Neptune pool, but even I found that to be a bit too pretentious) Oh, in case you are wondering, I do have a pool table and it is in a room, well, the basement. The clutter surrounding the table makes for a difficult game of 8-ball, however, once one becomes adept at avoiding side shots made difficult by the intrusion of boxes filled with 1970's porn magazines, it is manageable. The wicked stench emanating from the three unattended cat boxes is something you will adjust to eventually. (I haven't had a cat in over six years)

Inconveniently, my marital status seems to always be of interest to women who reply to my Craigslist ads. As a Craigslist man, I've learned that it's best to claim that I'm a divorced man and leave the untidy fact that my wife of 22-years sits at home with crippling clinical depression as she contends with her stage III lymphoma. Making such a disclosure does nothing to enhance my opportunity of arranging that first important meet-for-coffee date. Therefore, I go with the plausible divorced man scenario and ride it out until the eventual discovery of my deception. 

My experience has proven that a woman will inevitably ask about my occupation. More times than not, what I do for a living will be included within the first three questions asked by all women. Thanks to the internet, I've been able to research and speak convincingly about the methods and practices of being a day trader. I used to claim to being a foreign correspondent for Reuters until I ran into a woman at Walgreens with whom I had met earlier that day for coffee. I was picking up a prescription of Zoloft for my wife when that unfortunate situation occurred. ( The busses weren't running that day for my wife to run that errand so I reluctantly agreed to drive and pick-up the medication for her) Anyway, I had told her that morning that my flight to Budapest was departing in three hours. I falsely claimed that my assignment editor had just sent me a text to immediately get to Hungary and cover the migrant story. Her surprised expression was telling, so I ignored her. That unfortunate episode forced me to fabricate a new line of work to feed women's curiosity about my source of income. Being a day trader was perfect. It conveys a man possessing intellectual agility, esoteric expertise, and one willing to take calculated risks. Women eat that up faster than the iced lemon pound cake I so often enjoy when first meeting a respondent at Starbucks. Besides, I learned many many first dates ago that woman don't want to hear anything about my real work as a stock clerk at Vito's Liquor Emporium. 

Women, or so my personal history has taught, are interested in my emotional health. This is where it becomes tricky when first corresponding with a potential Starbucks date. It's not as easy as it may appear to conceal my self-loathing, tons of insecurities manifested by neglect during childhood, narcissism, inability to feel empathy, relate to other humans on any healthy level, dramatic and petulant mood swings, and intemperate behavior. I won't even begin to disclose my paralyzing fear of sex and being nude in front of a woman. As a general rule, I don't typically acknowledge my sexual dysfunctions. (With the exception of the visually and hearing impaired woman I met last month, I've never experienced more than one date with any woman, thereby rendering my sexual inadequacies a non-issue) The trouble that I have found is meeting a woman who views those little flaws for what they are: insignificant hurdles on the pathway to knowing me as a person, a man, a Craigslist man. Only then will I ever have a chance to enter into a meaningless and unhealthy relationship that can last an entire week. All I can say is thank goodness for Craigslist. Without Craigslist, my ability to contrive a wildly inaccurate, but affective, first impression would be compromised and all too transparent. 

When asked of my interests and hobbies, I come well-prepared. Reading, or so I insincerely claim, is a passion of mine. I disingenuously state that Sense and Sensibility is my all-time favorite book. What woman could possibly resist a heightened level of interest in a man who embraces Jane Austen? I've never read the book and so I steer quickly away from further discussion about it. I cite other hobbies that are designed to impress and create a flattering, but false, impression. Several of these phantom hobbies include being a self-taught flamenco guitarist, learning Russian, and taking tango lessons. The fact is that my only hobby revolves around lying prostrate on my couch as I deftly use the TV's remote control. Sports programming, loud and violent action films, and reality TV shows consume the vast majority of my viewing time. 

There you now have some of the tile pieces to the mosaic of me, along with my confessions. Whoever said that confessions are good for the soul apparently didn't possess the psychological afflictions that are firmly rooted within me - I feel no better.

Lastly, as a Craigslist man, I'll fight the temptation to corrupt this post by stating that I will now return to Austen's Pride and Prejudice. I need to cash my wife's disability check so that I may stock up on my liquor, smokes, and various snack chips before the Ice Road Truckers TV marathon. 

Sincerely,
A Craigslist Man

title: Closing walls and ticking clocks
text:
The worst part about falling backward is that we're still moving forward. An ending is a beginning. A tear is nourishing our soul so that it can grow. And Wonderland will always be a place, even if we think we'll never find it again. 

I believe that a body passes through a euphoric state before it dies. I've seen it time and again in the eyes, heard it in a voice, felt it in a hug that we don't know will be the last.

The rain was appropriate on this day. It came to me in a goodbye note. 

There comes a time when I tire of being tethered by my sins, when I give in to the captivity of fate. Death is not always the burial of a body no longer breathing. It is often a transition of our souls into a new realm. For me, it is falling out of Wonderland, leaving traces of my blood on the shards of the looking glass. As I pen my thoughts and move forward, my remembrances keep me in a bittersweet mind. 

The thing is, I like it there. It's where my compassion is rooted; I am more than just the Sad Girl who staggers away from happiness. I am a wanderer and sometimes my journey takes others away from me. It also takes me to places where few dare to go. It makes me unforgettable in a life I am prone to forget. 

"Never say never," the note repeated to me. Never comes from the same place as forever. Neither exist with any certainty, do they? Nor do goodbyes when one refuses to commit to it. 

That's my purgatory -- somewhere between leaving and staying.

title: With or without you...
text:
...I'll be doing it either way. It's just so much more pleasant to do it with someone.
You see, I spend most of my free time alone. Working crazy long hours, being on call on the weekends. Chores. Responsibilities. Obligations. Having the time and energy to put into a relationship just isn't in the cards for me right now.
So what's a healthy, virile, youthful-for-his-age man to do? He can't just "hold it". He needs to release, mentally and physically. It's healthy. Necessary. Inevitable. So what does he do? Why, he takes matters into his own hands, of course. That's all well and good, but having some company would make the experience much more gratifying, whether you participate or just watch. Sharing the experience with another human being makes all the difference.
So, I'm going to do it anyway. Would you like to be a part of it?

title: Intense pain
text:
The feeling of being needed but not wanted. Relied upon yet in a constant state of neglect. Forgotten about and left to survive, together, yet in a separate reality of solitude. 

The intense pain of intentionally avoided embrace, the forgotten feeling of simple touch, mutual nurturing and inner peace. Pain within the soul, more intense than any nerve ending would register. 

The simple act of exchanging a smile, a genuine hug, together on a park bench hand in hand. Never destined to lead to love, sex an urge forgotten, two people in pain, healing together, a friendship of mutual energy exchange, souls recharged.

title: I simply don't give a fuck...
text:
And neither should you. The sanctity of marriage is something we've created in our minds to address what seems to be a state of disorder. Some of you know this to be true and giggle about it as you browse these personals with your "Bestie". 

But you return to the vicious circle, a sucker for punishment. A life of servitude with little focus on the best things in life. A constant battle to silence your intuition. 

Oh, I can almost feel some of you begin to extend your claws, poised for attack. But I'm impervious! A layer of thick skin and a suit of chain mail and fresh filters installed. I speak not to the woman reading this but her innermost "questionable" desires. 

I won't sit here and dictate the sort of arrangement or relationship I'm looking for. It's far too dynamic. If you are a bitch, we will feed off of that and address it aggressively. If you are sweet and submissive, we will take things slowly and enjoy terms of mutual respect. If you are lonely and in need of attention, prepare to feel wholesome but don't expect a one way street. 

So get busy! Quit spending your morning coffee browsing ads and write something meaningful instead!

Cheers,

X.

title: humans rushing...
text:
Hello reader. I am looking for someone. Someone who, like me, has come to the realization, gradually and reluctantly perhaps, that while their life checks all the boxes one might hope to check and they are generally happy, they are not quite entirely fulfilled. 

They need something more. They have a tiny yet constant itch, somewhere in the back of their mind that they cant quite satisfy. The itch reminds them of a sense of excitement they had once upon a time. A sense of curiosity and intrigue that doesn't often manage to co-exist within the familiar and comfortable domain of a long and established relationship.

Just seeking to share trials and travails without judgment, make a new friend and someone who one can speak their truest thoughts, about the marathon called life.

If you're like me, you feel like an empty shell of what you once were.
Your passionate soul, whittled away by life's trials and relationships, is but a dry husk now.
Wouldn't it be nice to rediscover your sensual, playful, spontaneous side again?
It doesn't matter what your relationship status is.

It just matters that you want more.


Lets be 'human beings' and not 'human rushing to doings'.

title: Seek Cuban Salsa Dance Practice Partner
text:
Hi!
I have actually been dancing Salsa for a number of years off and on but now I am getting back into it in a more serious way. I take private lessons from some of the Bay Area's best female and male Salsa dancers but these lessons only take you so far - I think it is important to practice regularly. Sure, I go out dancing in clubs but dancing with a regular practice partner (or two) would allow me (and you, perhaps) to progress even faster. Don't hesitate because of my age - I am in great shape as a lifelong cyclist and health enthusiast (which does not prevent me from indulging in life's pleasures from time to time!). And, I have a good sense of humor, am bi-lingual (French) and in general love to have fun and enjoy life's little (and big) pleasures. Salsa music makes me want to dance, and especially the Cuban variety (Timba) - I love it. I don't understand the lyrics, of course, but I find that for dancing it doesn't matter all that much - the key is to find the downbeat, hold hands correctly, maintain your frame and keep in step while executing turns, moves and combinations (hopefully with some style), right?

I am 5'11" tall (150 lbs) so ideally I am looking for dance practice partners a few inches shorter than me - say, 5'5" to 5'9" or so. Please be at least at an Intermediate level with some pretty good dancing experience already in either Cuban or LA style, which will facilitate our compatibility for practicing. For example, you should be able to execute double turns, checks, hammer locks, barrel turns and/or a number of the standard Cuban Casino routines (dedo, setenta, sombrero, sencillo, el dos, el beso), just to name a few capabilities you should already possess.

In replying to this message, please tell me a little about yourself and why you like to dance. 

Thanks for reading this and regardless, I hope you enjoy your Salsa dancing, however you choose to pursue it!

title: Married Man Looking for Special Discreet Friendship

Thanks for reading my ad and I am glad I caught your attention. I went back and forth with how I ought to title this ad and finally landed on advertising for a "special discreet friendship." This is my first foray into the world of seeking such a friendship since being married. I am simply interested in making my life a little more exciting, giving it an extra kick, having some intrigue. It may be that you and I just email each other some spicy titillating (although respectful) emails; it may be that we decide to discreetly meet and chat over coffee/tea, or maybe explore things further if we are both mutually inclined. There are lots of possibilities. As far as I am concerned, we can't go wrong...

I am a Caucasian man, tall, attractive, stocky, gym-goer, early fifties, advanced degrees, professional, live and work in San Francisco, clean-cut, respectful, and very discreet. I would love to hear from women -- married or single between the ages of 25 and 60 -- who, for whatever reasons, want to engage in a friendship in which all limits are respected yet at the same time exploration is in the cards (whether that be through e-mails, meet ups, etc.). title: Tell me about your time on Craigslist

Have you met a friend through Craigslist? Ever met someone for an activity through a posting? Do you often post on forums or use rideshare? I'd love to talk to you about these experiences!

title: Female Road Trip Buddy
text:
I've been exploring CA for years. I've been to Death Valley eleven times and I especially, love deserts and wide open spaces.

I'm a very youthful retired late middle-aged woman (I have many friends in their 40s and 50s). Road trips for me include easy hiking and exploring local towns' thrift stores and shops. I'm quite flexible about duration of trips, from day-trips, to one or two nights or longer. My biggest problem in retirement has been finding women who have the time, money and desire to hit the road without much of an agenda. 

I have a wide range of interests and I love to laugh. I don't get my knickers in a twist over much. I'm a writer and big reader.

You must be able to pull your own weight and share expenses such as gas and lodging. 

Spontaneity and a sense of humor and curiosity are absolutely essential. 

The point of road trips is to take a break from daily life so please be able to disconnect from electronica except for basic checking in with relatives and such. I don't want to find myself staring at the top of your head as you text and photograph your food.

Let's talk and meet and see if we're on the same page. The days are getting longer and I'll soon be rarin' to go. I have a brand new Kia Rio and a GPS. It's easier if you're in or near San Francisco, but not essential.

I'm not averse to tent camping, and still have my equipment.

title: Totally Friendship - You, Unattached Woman: 50+
text:
Hi - If you are a woman, unattached, over Age 50 and like what you read below, I would like to hear from you with a little background and your personal goals. Plz attach a photo before requesting mine. 

A little about me: 

Relocated to the bay area from NJ/NY, in 1979. Yes, I miss the Big Apple and hope to go back and visit. 

Mild-mannered gentleman, College-Educated, non-judgmental, non-smoker, Fit/Healthy, romantic, financially & emotionally secure. I grew up travelling throughout Europe and the Middle East, because my dad was a international bank executive tasked with helping establishing bank branches, in many major cities in Europe and the middle east. I finally landed in NJ/NY area in 1970. My college and grad schooling were in upstate NY (Troy, NY).

Started my semi retirement, in early 2014.

My friends describe me as fun to be around, respectful, well-rounded, witty, calm, honest, compassionate, kind, sensitive, romantic & affectionate.. there are few more, I hope you discover'em! (Nooooooo, I am not near perfect - nor trying to be).

The outdoors, gardening, cooking, dancing, ethnic cuisine, sunsets, music, the theatre, classic movies, travel, moonlights.... & Life are among the things I enjoy.

I am fluent in French (the language).

I am not deterred by body type, religion, skin color or ethnicity so long we connect comfortably and harmoniously. I have a catholic background, but I am not fanatic about it. Among other components, I find Balance, Kindness, Sanity & Harmony are essential in Life.

My taste in music gravitates around Jazz, Classic Rock, World music... 

I prefer a romantic candlelight dinner with music, by the fireplace, to watching TV.

Please do NOT request a photo unless you've already attached yours. 

Happy Day!

title: Life is too short not to have an affair
text:
I know that most people only browse CL for entertainment value...to see if anything can still shock their jaded sensibilities, but there are messages of genuine substance to be discovered...even here. 

I'm looking for the woman who is unhappily married but who needs to stay married for practical reasons. The woman who lacks intimacy in and out of the bedroom. What I don't want is lunch time sex. I want a woman that has the flexibility to experience life with me outside the bedroom as well. I want someone who I think about when I wake up in the morning and when I lay down at night. I want the woman who makes my heart sing when I hear her voice on my phone or get an email from her.. 

Making love is incredible when relationships are nurtured and emotional bonds are formed. I have no plans to leave the marriage that I'm in -- it's just too complicated -- but I'm not willing to live out the rest of my life unfulfilled either. 

There must be a woman who finds herself in a similar situation -- a woman who is ready to build a long-term, secondary relationship. 
Honestly, the concept of an affair seems quite easy. Two attached people make a decision to mess around and well the rest is history. However, the more complicated question is how do those two attached people make it known that they are open to such an arrangement.

About me: 

Others would typically describe me as being laid back, very funny, considerate, respectful, spontaneous and at time shy. I like sports , reading, beach/camping, independent and mainstream films, dancing, hiking, road trips, Cooking, Cricket and good restaurants ( who doesn't). But I would trade them all for a night of warmth and cuddling at home in front of a good movie and some great take out food... Care to join...(wink)


About you: 

The woman I am looking for married like me but is starved for intimacy and ready for a sensual and cerebral adventure. I am discerning and patient; this is only worth doing if it really feels right. She has darker hair and eyes...maybe olive complexion...she might be of Latin, Mediterranean, Asian, or mixed heritage. For that matter, she could be a striking brunette of any origin....the dark features are just my preference. She is fit and feminine. Her hands are soft and graceful...they fit nicely in my large grasp. 

Naturally none of us should be into games or one-nighters! If we are on the same page about what we want, send me an email -- possibly to explore this discreet, adventurous new friendship

title: Seeking an Acro Yoga partner
text: I'm searching for a partner for Acro Yoga. title: Looking For a Squatchin' Partner Who Knows Something on the Subject...
text:
Hi.

First, this is a very peaceful, contemplative, and respectful practice of exploration. There is none of the nonsense you see on TV. The energy is very 'light', and is more about 'reverence' than anything else. Hard as it might be to believe, we have had some very unusual, and very unexpected success on a multitude of levels.

I have personally been doing this research for quite a few years now, and only been out in the field locally the last 3 to 4 years. Having headed out in the deep Marin terrain awhile back, a partner and myself discovered, quite by accident, some pretty compelling evidence of either visitations, or, outright habituation right here in the county. Having asked a few people I know I could trust, as well as using the BFRO website for historical references as to Marin events regarding possible Sasquatch incidents, there seems to be a very solid, and ongoing precedent for what we found. Unfortunately, the BFRO has taken down the references to any, and all Marin occurrences since they started the show 'Finding Bigfoot'. No surprise there, I guess. Anyway, it seems that some areas of the Marin watershed are indeed privy to visits in the same manner as is found in many parts of the greater north western states. 

My buddy John and myself are extremely grounded, fact and evidence based investigators when we have the time. Unfortunately, John has very little times these days to make these trips out to these 'Hot-Spots', as it were. Thus, I am looking for someone who has at least some knowledge of the subject, respects the subject at hand for what it is, and is also grounded, compassionate, caring, and respectful of the environment. Someone who can also remain 'Mum' on the areas in question. We do NOT seek any publicity, and prefer the findings of this research to remain within the circle of trusted people in the local community, of which there are very few thus far. I do however, share information on what we find with 2 of best investigators in the field. Again, in complete, non-public confidence.

Anyway, if you are interested in knowing more, and perhaps taking an excursion by car, or bike to some of the easier areas to explore where some great evidence has been found, then please write back to me with whatever you feel is appropriate that I should know about you. This is not an exclusive 'club' by any means. I can also assure anyone that the chances of a 'sighting' are basically zero. But, the vast area between upper Muir Woods, to the far end of Kent Lake in Lagunitas DO seem to have something very interesting going on on a fairly consistent basis. 

Please let me know your thoughts, experiences, ideas, even second-hand stories. The Sasquatch is not the only thing of a cryptid nature living in the hills of Marin as I, and many others have found out over the years. But, there is indeed some very fertile territory for new discovery along certain lines that the vast majority of people, even those interested in this subject, just know absolutely nothing about locally.

Look forward to hearing from you.

title: Hispanic Platonic Friend :)
text:
There are times when I stop and imagine how cool it will be for me to have someone to talk to or hang out with when I'm stressed or just need an escape from my daily routine. Someone whom I could just have a glass of beer, wine, champagne (or even tea!) and talk about life, watch TV or listen to music. Enjoy each others company, and perhaps advice each from a different perspective.

Who I Am
I'm a 33 year old Hispanic, born in Mexico and raised in California. I'm a university graduate, professional business owner. I have high ambitions in my personal and professional life, and I like to stay healthy and fit. I like dressing nice, and I'm often told I'm good looking by both gay guys and female friends.

Why it'll be an escape for me
I am attached. Before you judge, please know that it's all about perspective - you are not in my shoes. I even feel a bit embarrassed to write this, not because I think I'm doing something wrong, but because I know how the average person looks at this. My relationship is good and healthy, however, we are often too busy to pay attention to each other. 

I need something more. I would love having a healthy friendship with a female I could trust. I do have friends (both guys and girls) but most of them already play a role in my circle, and are mutual friends with my significant other.

Who I can connect with
I feel like I can connect with female between the ages of 25-40. Being Mexican is a plus since I know we would have a cultural connection, however it's not required. I would love someone who is professional, healthy, non-smoker/social smoker only (420 okay), who likes to take care of herself in mind and body. 

Drama free please. I have no drama in my life and I would like to keep it that way.

I would think the person I can connect the most with is someone who is also going through the same situation - being attached but needing an escape / companion outside the daily routine. However, if this is not your situation, as long as you can understand mine and not judge, I would be okay with.

That's it!! Is it too much to ask??

If interested, please tell me about yourself and why you think we can connect. A picture would be nice :)

text:

My favorite hike's are in Mill Valley but anywhere in the north bay is great for hikes. Pacifica is also full of great hikes. As for me, I'm 35, fairly athletic, an ambivert(introvert/extrovert) if I'm going to put a label on myself; I'm friendly(people actually tell me this) and outgoing, but enjoy the peace and calm of nature. My best friends are married with children so they aren't available as much as I'd like them to be, and I broke up with my girlfriend 6 months ago so I'm still figuring out how to occupy that time she filled. Not heartbroken if that's what you're thinking. Let me know if you'd like to meet, thanks

title: Want to Play Organized Baseball Again?
text:
Want to play real baseball? Y'know, the real thing: umpires, uniforms, the whole nine? (Hardball, NOT softball, to be clear.) If so, tryouts are happening tomorrow, February 28 at Balboa Park, Sundberg field (next to SFCC, 2000 San Jose Ave, San Francisco, CA 94112). If you can't make it to tryouts, please respond to this posting if you want to play and can't make the tryout. 

I manage the "Sting" of the 30+ age division. We are still looking for a few good players who want to play baseball. If you will be 30 years old by the end of 2016, if you love and respect the game of baseball and want to put the cleats on again, we want to hear from you. Anyone who has played organized baseball, particularly at the high school level and beyond, is encouraged to contact me for more information (ESPECIALLY pitchers and catchers!) 

FYI: anyone 21 years & older can play for a team in the Bay Area Mens Senior Baseball League (BAMBL) in the 21+, 30+, 40+ & 50+ age divisions. (Note: if you're older than a given age division, you can play in a younger division, but younger players cannot play in older divisions etc.) Please note, there are league fees involved (so we can rent fields & pay for umpires etc.) Games are on Sundays in April, through mid-September. Don't go soft(ball), play hardball this year! Email me now for more info and let's schedule a BP or throwing session!

title: Needing Advice
text:
I am need of some serious advice. This is strictly platonic. I do not seek anything else. Please do not flag this, I am really serious.

I am a 20 year old male. I have had a few serious relationships, took things slow, built a friendship and went from there. No relationship has lasted past the first few instances of sexual interaction. 

Two years ago I also developed a symptom that earlier this year was medically diagnosed as hyperspermia. 

In short, my body produces semen at an abnormal rate that makes me produce large amounts every time I ejaculate. I am serious. I don't mean that I produce "large" amounts as is the guy with the big inflated ego that thinks he's hot stuff. When I say I have been medically diagnosed, I am for real. I have been to the hospital (male urology dept), where I undertook a series of tests. I had to give samples twice a day, three times in a week, over 5 days. Whereas the average male produces around 1 teaspoon of semen, I consistently produced between 7 and 8 teaspoons, hence the hyperspermia diagnosis. 

In my personal life, this has been horrible. Every girl I've been with hates it. I makes messes. I overfill condoms (making dangerous messes, reproductive-wise), and have lost every relationship in the last two years. Girls think I'm a freak and I've been accused of taking drugs or supplements to make this happen. I don't.

Am I doomed? Will I never have a girl take me serious? Are all girls grossed out by this? I don't blame them. Like I said, I make a huge mess. It's embarrassing and I'm ashamed. Am I doomed? Does anyone know what I can do?

Any advice is greatly appreciated. 

Thank you,

James.

text:

He flipped. Called me a nigger lover and said I needed to find somewhere else to go.... Said he's glad he didn't raise me cause at least now he can't feel any blame for me being a race traitor.... Seriously. I've never heard this kind of rhetoric spewed at me before. Yes my son os mixed. His momma is black and I'm white... And my son is the most handsome little boy that ever lived so I don't care that he's darker than me...

Anyway now I have to get back to Pasadena where at least I have a few couches I can sleep on until I get some income rolling. I've tried for almost a week to do it here and find a job and a temporary place to stay but nothing has happened for me. People won't hire me on the spot and I have no clue how long this could take.

Now I'm soaking wet and really tired of hanging out in Starbucks all day to stay dry. 

I'm posting this in hopes that someone here can put me to work or something. I need to earn my ticket back to Pasadena. It's roughly 75 and I'm dwindling every day I stay here. I may have less than twenty in the bank by now.

I'll do anything for work. At home I've always worked in cLl center's but even with the absence of a man raising me I still know how to use some tools and fix some things.

Anyway. Please put me to work. Km ready to go to my friends in Pasadena and fake a shower and sleep a whole night.... Dry....

title: A Dad Figure
text:
It's a bit different, I know, but I'm missing a dad-type person in my life. I never had one growing up and didn't think much about it, but curiously the impact of missing out on that role model is just now hitting me in my 40s. But you don't necessarily have to be older than me to fill the father role; it's in the attitude.

I'm looking for a man who is strong (mentally & physically), masculine, healthy & reasonably fit to do physical activities, 35-55, kind, educated, good-natured, has integrity, and single (my married friends have little time to get together). If you want companionship, someone you can show and teach your interests to, and you're left of center or willing to let politics alone, we may be a fit. I'm a 5'4" guy, go to gym, active, friendly, compassionate, sometimes childlike in a good way, playful sense of humor, loyal, want to spend time with a man I can look up to and respect. 

The level of mentorship is up to you...you can be a full-on Dad type and have guidlines, a more casual big brother, or something in between. I just ask that you take the lead in what we do, as I need to relinquish planning for a change. Does not need to be romantic/sexual; being friends is fine. Open to what you like...hiking, camping, kayaking, sports, beers, wine, live music, traveling, hanging out at home--almost anything. Pass on your knowledge/skill and have someone enjoy your world with you on your terms, and let's have fun together!

title: one altruist to another
text:
Lets keep a diary of ours thoughts and ideas on how to leave this world having made a long lasting and positive impact. Over time lets build and implement strategies to concretize the thoughts and realize those ideas. 

As I see it, we live in a world that's rampant with inequity, a world where selfish and inconsiderate people outnumber the kind and caring. A world full of people who wouldn't skip a heart beat while bulldozing anyone in their path to success. Lobbyist-puppets disguised as politicians are the norm. Armed with hidden agendas their only goal is to block all progress. Then, there are those that are hardworking. There are two types - those who work hard to ensure a few can build stockpiles of cash, and those who work hard selflessly for the welfare of others, for the betterment of this planet and to be good human beings. I want to be among the latter but I find myself increasingly becoming the former, after all I am a silicon-valley employee and that is how I earn my money! Be my support and I'll be yours while we transform ourselves into the hardworking kind of the latter type.

Even in this age of Facebook, Twitter and Youtube effecting change is a daunting task. Some people believe that technology can solve all our problems. They couldn't be more wrong. Some changes occur in a few years, some may take a decade and some others may take over a century. In my opinion, for one person to bring about change is almost impossible. Two is a team, with a few more we have a force, gather enough people and we have a revolution.

My goal is to build small-scale prototypes that produce concrete results and serve as models for larger scale implementations, which unfortunately may not be realized in my lifetime. I have some ideas of my own to share and would love to hear yours. Lets do something as a team, something to be proud of on our deathbeds. I don't seek fame or fortune, but I do seek the company of others to keep me motivated and on my toes, serving people and this planet every year, every month and every day for the rest of my life.

title: Doing stuff.
text:
It would be great to go to the movies, take scenic walks, dine out and just be spontaneous with someone who's open to living life without holding back. Ultimately I do want to meet "the one" and hey, if that happens here even better but that isn't at all what I'm expecting. 

I've only had one sb/sd relationship in my life and that lasted almost five years. It was mutually rewarding but like all good things it peacefully ended. As you can see I'm looking again for someone who equally loves adventure but can mix it in with a sexual arrangement. I love trying new things and it doesn't have to be all about sex but I do want that as part of the agreement. I'm sure you appreciate straightforwardness. 

I love a girl who can still wear heels when we stand next to each other. Don't count yourself out if you're petite :) I'm over 6ft, cute, tall and considered a handsome man. I'm disease free and will always try to make time for someone who's good in bed and a great friend. I'm looking for someone cute with a great personality, brain, and sense of humor! I'm looking for a long term friend with benefits, not just a one time, nsa thing. A weekly stipend is what I was thinking and I'm good for it.

If this is what you're looking for please share what your expectations for a stipend type of arrangement would be like? How many times a week do you think realistically you could meet up? Are you single? Is your place available some of the time or would we always have to come to my place? When you write feel free to ask me any questions you may have. Please tell me a bit about yourself as well as send some good pictures. I will be happy to answer anything and send pictures of myself.

When an attractive guy has an education and a good job, people ask why is he still single this late in the game? Girls ask specifically, "What's wrong with him?" I'll be perfectly honest. I've had back to back long term traditional relationships before having an arrangement and this is something that just works for me right now. I plan on settling down one day but the problem right now is that I work and travel a lot. 

I really, really like my job, and unfortunately it requires me to go places on short-notice. I do a lot of driving all over California and along the West. My schedule gets in the way of dating and this situation works perfectly for a student or someone who has equal needs. I don't think it would be an issue if I had a long-term girlfriend, but it's a big problem when you're trying to get past the first few dates just getting to know each other and the girl discovers that my schedule is just all over the map.

The girl I'm looking for is anywhere between 5'2''-5'9'' with blonde, brunette or red hair. She has blue, green or hazel eyes and is slim and takes care of herself. I'm open to HWP as long as you take care of yourself and stay healthy and active. I love a girly girl but also a girl who doesn't mind getting her hands dirty. I'm open to different ethnic groups. :) 

With all of this said, are you that someone who's open to a friend's-with-benefits scenario while being compensated for it? I'm pretty sexual and frankly it's difficult to find somebody who can accommodate my schedule. I think if we didn't expect a big emotional commitment from each other then maybe it would be simpler. I'm not really interested in being a "player." No games. To be honest, I'm not opposed if we do end up developing feelings for each other but that's down the road. Who knows what could happen....

title: Your Bucket List...
text:
I've experienced more in my life than most have imagined themselves getting the chance to at least try. I'm not bragging, I believe some to do with achievement, and much serendipity. Whatever the reasons, a few remain. 

Today I pondered how many rarely experience the realization of much that's on their list. So here goes perhaps another unanticipated chapter in life that happens just because. 

My posting is directed toward women because I believe my thoughts and spirit quicken more holistically with the soul of most woman. Mind and soul are critical elements that must harmonize for you and I to share in order to achieve convergence beyond even a personal level; beyond finding words for capturing tonalities of the essence of mind that escape as whimsically as they appear. 

No, I'm not a transcendental voyager, or lay claim to meanings of revelations more profound than they are real. What I believe I am blessed with is the capacity toward introspective awareness channeled through empathic sharing of the essential harmonies of life untold. In other words I often experience the deja Vu of things that may or may not occur -premonition of state without basis of their meanings. 

So if you're still with me after my ethereal journey, what my ambition here today is to engage with another toward achieving a significant experience that remain unfulfilled. Something in your bucket list that I may be so privileged to see and hear through your minds eye, that perhaps the two of us can embark on a quest to turn those thoughts into a shared and journeyed reality; a notch in your bucket list you never imagined would ever be there. Namaste!

Please share your thoughts with me!

title: Ideal friendship...different outcome. Read entire ad please :)
text:
Getting right to the point this is not facebook...so looking for just friends only here is not the #1 goal. I'm realistic so only respond to me if you can be realistic too. I know most guys online want that 'one thing' on everyone's mind. But I'm different. Honestly I want to take things to the sexual level I'm looking for with you first THEN mix friendship in, to make sure we click on that friendship level after hooking up. I do things my way, not the "normal" way. Try to follow along. Why meet for regular "dates" just to immediately assume that you don't click with someone only because you're so nervous? 

I like to have fun like most guys on these personals but I also like having deep conversations and making actual progress with someone along the way. So no I do not want what others want for their secret agendas; I want a guy that I can get to know a little first over the phone, go to your house to talk and hook up ON THE FIRST MEET, then be prepared to more than potentially have an on-going friendship with benefits if it's there. I'm more than capable of being real friends with real benefits, and am strongly looking for a guy who can be ready enough to follow my lead.

For hanging out I like movies, hiking, shopping, definitely clubbing, can do video games, walking around town, going out to local eateries to avoid fast-food and more. I'm 5'9 tall, masculine, average to thicker/stocky body build, short hair casual attire. Sometimes classy when going out but still masculine. I'm down to earth, funny, open-minded, outspoken, etc. Please be single and not currently attached to someone like your ex. Save the complications.

I do not send face pics, and I am not into judging looks or appearance. Too many people with fake pics and phony intentions, or robots who are simply pic collectors. We can talk on the phone, connect then just meet in person because I have nothing to hide so why try to stop at pictures? In fact I find that the best connections come from not having high expectations off of looks. Instead of being shallow, just be attracted to a personality, not a picture/looks. Race isn't important to me; however I do like being interracial whether it be friendship or more.... Clearly you should feel the same way. I only expect replies from guys who are open-minded about any race. In example, I love Latinos and Asians (yum) but if someone other than that is ringing my bell, then it is what it is :) For the record I'm a top looking for a submissive bttm to be down with who loves sex...and you be able host when we go further or for plan B in the car somewhere parked because I cannot host. Like under the stars chillin'.

Keeping in touch is key...We all have busy lives--you ARE NOT the only one with a busy schedule. If you say you want to meet, just fucking make the time for it and keep the plans. Or else stay the fuck offline. I cannot stress that enough. And back to pictures, it's annoying to exchange pictures with guys who can't follow through or keep the momentum going...if you're claiming to want even just a friend you should already have the time for them. By the way there's no sure way to tell if someone is a match on day 1. Real chemistry doesn't happen in 5 seconds, it happens over time after discovering there are general mutual interests. I want a guy who's prepared to meet with me a few different times before judging any chemistry.

The only real preference for FWB I have is age...I need a guy around my age who can keep up with me. So 18-29 hmu. But since it's a preference not a requirement, older guys feel free to be bold and hmu if you think we can still be good together :)

title: Underappreciated, overstressed and always giving or doing for others?
text:
Is life is pulling you in every direction and feeling overwhelmed and need a break? What better way to plug in, recharge and balanced than by a therapeutic, nurturing and pampering massage? 

For some this time year can be extra challenging. After all the holiday season celebrations are done, the New Year expectations, family demands, work overload or just life... can leave us feeling over stressed, lonely and blue.

What I offer is a place for you to share, be heard and understood. What you want and need is number important. What you feeling matters to me. You can relax, totally receive and totally let your hair down. You can feel empowered to be selfish and for it to be only about self care and self love just for you.

I am sensitive, empathic, nurturing and 100% unconditionally giving. I have been giving massage professionally for over 20 years and take pride in providing a safe place and service that is completely about you. I love what I do and right now I am humbly offer a sliding scale for those in need. I am not your average therapist and open and willing to work out what can serve your needs best.

My goal is to help uplift your spirits, create harmony mentally, physically as well as emotionally and to always be a place you can count on to be private, secure and discrete. 

Be sincere and real. No time for games or drama. Please tell me your favorite color for a response. I sincerely welcome you to reach out and allow me the opportunity to assist you in creating harmony and balance now and in the future.

title: Bizarro me
text:
Hi. I'm an asian engineer in my mid 30s, and all my coworkers in this male dominated industry are typically just like me, that is, book smart, clean cut indian or Chinese men. 

I'd love to get to know a new friend who's the opposite of me, whom I would have never met because our social circles would never otherwise overlap. I'm looking for someone who lives a different culture and life style, which may seem mundane to you but eye-opening to me, and vice versa. After all, experiencing different life styles make this journey called life more colorful, a la foreign exchange. So, do you have tattoos? Do you speak Spanish? Are you from Taiwan? Are you blonde? 420 friendly? Do you follow a potato based diet? Whatever it is, as long as you're different than me, I think you're cool!

In full disclosure, I'm not that exotic having come here from Hong Kong for over 20 years. But I'm sure my deeply rooted asian heritage and love for dim sum would be interesting to you. After all, if you aren't Chinese, you may feel awkward going into a Chinese restaurant. Am I right or am I right? :D

title: from one writer to another - come join my writing group
text:
If you're a writer, you know that when a specific moment engulfs you -- you just have to get the thoughts out of your head. For some of us, it's moments of sadness or loneliness, or the pain is so great that you have no choice but to write about it. I've been there ever since I was 12 so I know how it is. At least for me I couldn't go a day without writing. The pain was too deep and writing was my outlet. For the last 5 years or so I stopped writing. I decided I just didn't want to anymore and believe it or not, there wasn't ONE thing that compelled me to write. I played the piano a bit but writing was gone. . ..Until. . .My health was threatened. The possibility of breast cancer entered my life like from out of nowhere. I had to take a bunch of tests but I ended up OK. While this was happening I had to sit at the Thanksgiving table and act like life as usual when for me it wasn't. Then, my son fell after kicking a soccer ball and got really hurt. I don't want to get into all of that but basically like dominoes one thing after another has happened and keeps on happening. What do you think I started doing? Write. I haven't written as much as I would have because of my extenuating circumstances but I started to write again.

Writing heals, we all know this. Sometimes it's not about our pain -- it's constructed into a short story or something like that.

Being 45 I thought this group, would be great for those around my age. We'll have more in common, I think. But again, it's not a "pre requisite".

I created a Yahoo Group called "Writing Heals" and it would be great if you would join and give it a chance. I mean, what's the worst that can happen? Maybe you can meet some other people who are going through similar situations and this group could be about healing.

The only thing I don't want to do is LIMIT the type of writing share in this group. It could be any genre. I know for me, as a distraction, I dabble in some erotica. Maybe you did too. 

If you have any interest, 

email me at scarletblack0307 @ yahoo . com and I will send you the link to join. 

It would be an honor to get to know you.

Scarlet

title: Seeking local activity partner (walks, hikes, running, etc.)
text:
I'd like to meet someone who is local (Vallejo, Benicia, American Canyon), who'd enjoy having a partner to do such things was walks, local hikes, or runs (if that's your thing, it's ok if not). I am posting this in strictly platonic, as I am not seeking more than a friend. I posted m4w, as I tend to have more female than male friends. Your age (and mine) shouldn't be that much of an issue, since this is platonic.

Sometimes, having an activity partner with whom to exercise can help in motivation, and can also make one comfortable taking a local hike, or even just walking.

I live in a nice part of Vallejo. Vallejo has a few decent neighborhoods for walking/jogging (and of course some bad areas). The waterfront can be a good spot. Mare Island has several great areas, with water views (on the back side, away from all the industrial stuff). Benicia State Park is nice (I have a permit to park free there). There are some interesting hiking spots on the hills across from Lowes. And, there's a neat and large county park (with amazing views) off the 80 about a mile north of Vallejo.

If having a friend to do such things potentially sounds interesting, then drop me a line, and let's talk. I would like to meet someone who is up for doing something active a few times a week. Assuming we get along, I'd like this to be a fairly regular thing.

If we develop a friendship, it might also be nice to have someone with whom to grab coffee, attend a local arts/Farmer's Market event with occasionally, and just do friend-type things. But, if we just are exercise partners, that's fine too.

So, I'd say we talk, meet for a walk down by the ferry building, and if we feel comfortable, we can plan some other walks (or a run/hike) and go from there.

Thanks!

I've worked at the library as a tech for about 15 years. A huge part of our day is taking care of patrons, both in person and on the phone, who come from a wide demographic. I've received many letters of praise from patrons which I'd love to share with you. I also received a yearly staff recognition award from the library for my excellent customer service.

I also design and make jewelry. I sell and show my work in shops and galleries, as well as direct sales. Running my own small business has encompassed a huge variety of skills.

Over the years I've had other small businesses, both by myself and with my sister. At times I've worked with SOMAR, an artist resource center who were responsible for putting up the stages at various street fairs. Although I'm a petite 5'1", this kind of physical work is very much within my capacity.

You can see, I've had a varied and interesting work history.

I look forward to meeting you.

title: Somehow, there is no joy...
text:
I am 40 something now...
and for whatever reason things that were bring joy before, don't anymore...
I run my business[es], run my errands, and hardly have any will power to get out there and play because somehow the game doesn't bring joy...
Ironically, I fix others' people lives... Can kick people out of depression, apathy, fatigues...
Yet, as I look at my life - all tactics seem to fail. As if something happen to my will power to look for the beauty in the randomness and recurrence... Everything seem to be a replay of the old, and somehow new eyes just don't "turn on". I can "fake it till I make it" with all the practices and exercises, yet...
I am still "gorgeous, brilliant, charismatic", as they say, and hardly care about any of it...
People and human perceptions, all conversations and activities feel like one big mush-up...
Where is the f-n joy?

title: Female Friend Wanted
text:
I am looking for a female friend to do things with primarily on weekends. Dinners, symphony, sightseeing, tennis, hikes, you name it. I am a widower and my teenage kids tell me "to get a life". I have not done anything like dating since my wife passed away 5 years ago. Besides my kids, friends are telling me essentially the same . I am a supervisor where I work and the job keeps me mentally on my toes. So sometimes I just like "chilling" by watching a movie so we don't nessarily have to be out on the town every weekend. I am hoping whomever I meet opens me up to new sights and activities.
I am fairly open minded and not judgemental. I can debate any topic with you as long as we stay civil and respectful. I'd like to end any discourse with a smile. After all, the purpose of having a friend is to enjoy something together not to convert a mind to your thinking.
I posted in Platonic because a lot of the m4w postings are weird, drug loving or frankly are far more into sexual activity than I 'd like to go into least initially. We can stay platonic or get more involved but the impetus for deeper physical involvement will have to come from you.
I am looking for someone over 40 though I'd take a look at a younger lady of course. If your interested send me a picture of yourself and tell me a bit what you like to do for recreation. Also, I am not interested in more commuting so please be in San Francisco or within 15 miles. I will reciprocate a face picture in kind, body picture in kind and so forth. Thank you for reading the post and I hope to hear from you even if it's for one date only.

title: Tahoe Ski trip with Alice 97.3 and Sarah & Vinnie Ritz-Carlton radio contest
text:
Shoot me your best offer, or trade. please read everything, especially the eligibility pics.

A chance to be my guest on a trip of a lifetime. I won a skip trip to go to Tahoe, CA (Truckee,CA) on the ALICE 97.3 Sarah & Vinnie morning Radio show. I don't have any friends out here that know how to snowboard or ski. The is put on by CBS RADIO. THIS IS A 100% legitimate auction.

PLEASE MESSAGE or text WITH ANY QUESTIONS. 
So you MUST know how to ski/snowboard, so I have someone to ski with. This NORTH STAR Resort is halfway up the mountain for an awesome Ski-in Ski-out experience. Five Star amazing vacation. 
 
Sit in on the live radio broadcasts AND the post show SECRET SHOW.  
About me:
I'm 25, Male, pretty outgoing, Caucasian, well educated, I'm a real down-to-earth laid back guy. I'm bringing my guitar for their jam sessions, so if you know how to play, that's great. I was a snow board instructor for 3 years, so I'd like someone that could keep up. 
 
About you:
Awesome, fun, guy/girl, older/younger, must ski/snowboard, if You play an instrument that's even better. Prefer a fan of the the show, probably someone from the Bay Area.
Make sure you read all the pics and description. If you don't ski, please don't bid. 
 
THE ONE DOWNSIDE IS THAT WE WOULD SHARE A ROOM, WITH 2 DOUBLE BEDS, kind of like an overnight camp getaway. I don't snore and I'm not picky at all, if you don't want to hang out at all that's cool too, we probably won't be in the room that much anyways. Just need a ski buddy and someone to enjoy this trip with and please don't be creepy or a murderer. 
 
This is not meant to sound like a personal ad, so please don't think it is. I don't care about your religious beliefs, sex, age (must be 21+), race or political views. 
 
Upon winning this auction, I will send you 2 forms that are required by CBSRADIO.COM, ALONG WITH A SCANNED PICTURE OF YOUR LICENSE, SO I CAN SUBMIT THEM TO THE PROMOTIONAL STAFF, BY THIS MONDAY.
 
I will be renting a nice 4-wheel SUV For the ride up. You can meet me at my apartment in Hayward, CA, or meet me at the Ritz-Carlton, up to you.
 
This is what I was sent....
 
Congratulations on winning a trip for two to party with Sarah and Vinnie at The Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe, courtesy of our friends at the Bay Club! Before we get the party started, here are some important things you need to know:
You must present a credit card upon check in (I will provide this). Any other incidental costs such as room service, the mini-bar, or any other purchases charged to your room will be your responsibility. Please note that The Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe is a pet-friendly resort. If you choose to bring your pet, there is a $250 one- time, non-refundable fee. This is your responsibility. Additionally, the day-rate for parking at the hotel is $39.
The Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe ski resort is situated mid-mountain on the Northstar California ski area and features ski-in, ski-out access in addition to the resort's many luxurious amenities and services. At The Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe, guests can enjoy all winter has to offer enhanced by:
• True North, the on-site ski retail and rental shop
• Personal mountain concierge services
• Complimentary gondola between the resort and the nearby Village at Northstar
California
Check in at The Ritz-Carlton in Tahoe is at 4pm on Wednesday, March 16, 2016. The hotel is located at 13031 Ritz Carlton Highlands Ct., Truckee, CA 96161
Here is a brief itinerary that outlines the highlights of your trip:
Wednesday, March 16, 2016
• 4p -- check in at the hotel
• 6p - Apres Ski Reception at Alpine Club (Located in Northstar Village) -- take the complimentary
gondola from the hotel to Northstar Village. The gondola schedule is included in this welcome letter.
Thursday, March 17, 2016 Sarah and Vinnie Live Broadcast!
• 6a -- 9a - Live Broadcast & Breakfast at The Pines -- Get ready for some St. Patrick's Day fun with Sarah
and Vinnie! Make sure you don't miss this morning's broadcast because the Bay Club will be passing out a special gift for all the Alice winners! And wear some green so you don't get pinched by Hooman!
• A short break after the broadcast - Sarah and Vinnie Record the Secret Show!
• Hit the slopes at Northstar California!
Friday, March 18, 2016 Sarah and Vinnie Live Broadcast!
• 6a -- 9a Live Broadcast & Breakfast at The Pines -- because when Sarah and Vinnie hit the road, they
don't do only one...but TWO live broadcasts. Please join us again for breakfast and a re-cap of Thursday's fun.
• Check out is at 11am on Friday, March 18.
Thank you for listening to Alice and for participating in the Sarah and Vinnie Party in Tahoe! Alice would like to also thank the Bay Club for their generosity in providing these trips and all the happy moments to be had at the Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe! Thank you Bay Club!

Please don't say you're "board." please know that the it's not "alot" but "a lot" and also know that a difference exist between "your" and "you're." That also goes for "there," "their" and "they're."

title: Married, once married or in a LTR with a woman
text:
If you're a married man (or once were) or if you're in a long-term relationship with a woman and you'd like a discreet place to discuss your sexuality and form genuine friendships with similar men, please check out the "Married/Once Married Men's Group" that meets weekly at the Pacific Center in Berkeley. It's the only group of its type that meets in the Bay Area.

Although the group is primarily platonic, there have been times in the past when a long-term romance has developed between two members.

One thing the group is NOT is a place to find hook-up partners.

The group is anonymous and the confidentiality of all participants is protected. Current "regulars" range in age from 28 - 68 and the average number of attendees each week is nine. Meetings are every Wednesday night, from 8pm - 9:50pm. The Pacific Center is located at 2712 Telegraph Avenue in Berkeley.

I started attending more than three years ago when I was looking for feedback on coming out to my teenage kids. I didn't expect to attend more than once, but because the guys' feedback was so helpful, I returned to tell them how it went. I've been hooked ever since. I've found my tribe - there's no other social group like it. The dynamic is neither straight nor gay, it's somewhere in between.

I'm posting this information, not because the group needs more participants, but because it's a unique resource that hundreds of men have found invaluable throughout the group's 30+ year history.

Hey there!

Are you also involved with someone, who at one time may have been exciting but no longer is? Not just sexually (though that may be a big deal for you), but emotionally? Have you drifted apart, yet stay together for your own reasons? Would you like to commiserate sometime over coffee?

But seriously, I'm a handsome (maybe I'm bias), tall, average-built, also involved, 40-something, looking for a similar "ear" to share stories and even closely guarded secrets. I'm witty, intelligent, very cordial and considerate, love probing questions, and enjoy deep conversations - especially the most controversial subjects (with the most intellectually stimulating woman).
