title: Forming a Secular Gay Brotherhood
text:
Hi,

I am at the very beginning of forming a Secular Gay Brotherhood. This would be a co-operative, or commune if you like, of gay men interested in living together in community, bonding through a shared philosophy of naturism, education and philanthropy. I always envisioned some form of a phallic worship ritual and/or shrine, but that isn't required.

The group would be very similar to an all male religious group, like a monastery or priory, but would be secular in nature. 

There is an opportunity to obtain a vacant campus of buildings formerly used as a detention and education center for delinquent boys. 

I am seeking committed men serious about forming an active group to devise a business plan, explore funding opportunities, including crowd funding, and move forward to establish the Brotherhood formerly and make a competitive bid on the listed property.

In-kind help and donated services in the areas of: legal, business, accounting and tax, fundraising/development, advertising/promotion and tech/online/social media services are needed.

Please contact me with your thoughts on the project and I'll forward the property details and plans for you to review. 

Thank you!

In Brotherhood,

Max

P.S. Where else should this information be posted?

title: Therapy Group in SF for gay men over 50
text:
Get honest and caring support. 
Explore possibilities. 
Develop direction in your life. 

I am a licensed clinical psychologist and have been leading therapy groups since the 1970s. There are one or two openings in the therapy/support group I lead on Thursday evenings in San Francisco, for gay men over 50. 

Issues discussed in the group include clarifying one's life goals; relationships with friends, family, and partners; finding meaning and connection; and the many other challenges of aging. The age range of the current group members is broad, from the late 50s through the 70s. The group meets every Thursday evening from 7:00 to 8:30 pm, in my office on Clement Street. There is a monthly fee.

I offer a no-cost in-person screening interview. 

Thank you!

title: Drive, And Cross The USA For Free!
text:
I didn't know where to post this because we are looking for something different, as you will see. 

We are two bicycle riders from the East Bay who plan on riding across the USA, from Santa Monica to St. Petersburg, Florida, starting in June 2016 and ending mid to late August. 

We are looking for a driver for a support vehicle and the driver can bring a friend for company/as a chaperone. We will pay all expenses for both of you, including air fare, lodging and food during the trip. 

We will drive to Los Angeles where we can stay for a couple of days to sight see if you would like (I have a large condo there). We then start our ride toward Palm Springs and on to the Grand Canyon (a wonder of the world and photos really do not do it justice). From there we will travel through such places as Flagstaff and Sedona, Arizona, Albuquerque, New Mexico (with its Native American culture), Santa Fe (one of the art capitals of the world), Carlsbad Caverns, Austin (probably the most progressive city in Texas), San Antonio (home of the Alamo and its river walk which doesn't rival Venice but is nonetheless fun), Baton Rouge, New Orleans (home of Cajun cooking and Mardi Gras) and finally St. Augustine (the oldest continuously occupied European settlement in the US). We will spend rest and visiting days in the more interesting places so it won't be just a "drive by" experience.

There will be boring stretches of vast expanses, but more importantly, you will have the chance to see more small town "Americana" than most Americans get to see while experiencing Tex-Mex food, parts of the "Old West," Louisiana, Florida and much more. We will take a different route driving back across the country to see different places, probably including Las Vegas. 

Because the two of us will be riding our bikes going to Florida, your driving will only be from 50 miles to at most 115 miles per day, with some days off for our rest and to visit places of interest. We would like you to do laundry once a week or so while we are riding as well as some food shopping and preparation (lunches, such as sandwiches) and help with planning our lodging and stops.

You need to be good natured, responsible, easy to get along with, be drug free and, of course, have a valid driver's license with no major violations. This is perfect for a college student, a recent graduate who doesn't yet have a job or possibly a teacher who wants to spend vacation time exploring.

In the photo with the view in the background, I am 2nd from the right and Nick is 4th from the right. In the photo in front of a building, Nick is 3rd from the right (in the yellow) and I am immediately to his right, with the "Garneau" top. On the bikes, Nick is in the middle, I am on the left.

We are 2 responsible professional men who live in the East Bay (Nick in Pleasant Hill, me in Orinda). I don't know that it is relevant, but Nick is single and I am in a ltr. 

Let us know if you are interested.

Thank you, and here is to the adventure of a life time,

Rick

title: Inescapable something
text:
You and I are both a little lonely. I know, its hard to swallow but truth is we have trouble connecting day to day. I'm not insulting or judging, just trying to have a different and honest interaction. I feel vulnerable admitting it, but I know if someone reaches out, they will be genuine, and something like that is nice. We both have that knowledge of one another. I'm not desperate and I'm not searching for 'the one'. I have a good life which lacks that inescapable something.

I love words and the positive impact they can have on our minds. I don't have ANY hidden agendas and I won't judge you and only ask the same in return...this is simply a way for me to escape for a little while. I'd prefer to converse with someone my own age, mostly due to the amount of pop culture references I will likely be sprinkling into our correspondence. We don't have to write every day. I'm not always available and I'm not expecting you to be either.

As an aside: We're trying to put forth the very best qualities (both personality-wise and physical appearance) of ourselves or perhaps trying to shine up those we think will appeal to others. Trying to conform to some un-achievable archetype that doesn't really exist. We all have flaws and quirks that make us unique - and I think we should embrace and own them. Yes?

While meeting in person is not always plausible, it doesn't preclude us from sharing a photo or two for curiosities sake - but we don't have to do that either. Sometimes the mystery is the best part.

Read this somewhere and found it so appropriate:

I don't know why I chose this road
as blind success turns to folly 
as doubt and fear become commonplace 
the stout hearted become circumspect
the truth of lies so freely told;
we friends are made of liars and cheats 
no safety in the hearts of friends
no truth from lips so stained with tears.

Yep, this is in Strictly Platonic. There are some very good reasons for this. 1, I am not looking for meeting up with anyone here. I am single but I'm just looking to email/chat about this. So Men 4 Women is out. 2, Casual Encounters is full of utter and complete garbage. I looked around there 3 times today and saw nothing but mountains of spam and hookers. Awful!

So. What's the deal with this post then? The deal is there is something about stockings that is just completely delicious to me. I'm not talking about pantyhose or tights. I'm talking about thigh high stockings (with or without garter straps).

But having spent some time here I realize that this post is a total shot in the dark. The only time I see posts about lingerie like this it's dudes looking for women or other guys who are into it.

Sooooooooo... My goal here is to find a woman that is into this sort of lingerie too. A woman that is willing to share her thoughts. Baring that a woman that is curious as to why us men are so into lingerie ;)

This is NOT about meeting someone, or even an "in" to get, um, in your pants. I am single but just want to babble online.

Wish me luck. I'm going to need it!

title: Female Road Trip Buddy - w4w
text:
I've been exploring CA for years. I've been to Death Valley eleven times and I especially, love deserts and wide open spaces.

I'm a very youthful retired late middle-aged woman (I have many friends in their 30s and 40s). Road trips for me include easy hiking and exploring local towns' thrift stores and shops. I'm quite flexible about duration of trips. My biggest problem in retirement has been finding women who have the time, money and desire to hit the road without much of an agenda. 

I have a wide range of interests and am generally conceded to be very funny. I don't get my knickers in a twist over much. I'm a writer and big reader so I take my laptop and write when there's downtime.

You must be able to pull your own weight and share expenses such as gas and lodging. 

Spontaneity and a sense of humor and curiosity are absolutely essential. 

The point of road trips is to take a break from daily life so please be able to disconnect from electronica except for basic checking in with relatives and such. I don't want to find myself staring at the top of your head as you text and photograph your food.

Let's talk and meet and see if we're on the same page. The days are getting longer and I'll soon be rarin' to go. I have a brand new Kia Rio and a GPS. It's easier if you're in or near San Francisco, but not essential.

I'm not averse to tent camping, and still have my equipment.

title: Stoner IT geek musician guy in Seattle seeking new friends for stimula
text:
Maybe you've thought about moving to the PNW, or maybe you're just bored and want a new friend to exchange emails with. Whatever the case may be, I'm available for email or chat. Please only respond if you're going to take the time to write a decent response; no one-liners please. I appreciate well-written letters and I tend to get along with creative/intellectual types. I have been missing that type of connection lately.

So, being that I live in Seattle, you may have me somewhat figured out. I smoke weed, I drink coffee, I work in technology, and I'm progressive. I have LGBT friends and family. So, we may not mesh well if you're religious or conservative, though I'm open for debating stuff if that's your thing.

I work in IT for a popular retail company. As I mentioned, I work a night shift which leaves me fairly isolated, however I only work 3-4 nights a week, so that's nice because it allows me time to work on music and do other productive things like play video games and watch movies. I like working nights, being awake at night. It's peaceful and sort of like a whole different world. I do stay up until around noon, so it's not like I don't get to see daylight ever, but this schedule does not seem conducive to making new friends.

I play and record guitar, bass, synths, drums, and vocals. I don't have a band right now, but I'm hoping to put one together soon, and I'm hoping that playing my music live will help with meeting people. My music is sort of indie rock with some electronica. My musical tastes range from jazz like Ella Fitzgerald and Miles Davis, to bands like Tool and Radiohead. I was raised on The Beatles, Paul Simon, Billy Joel, Abba, classic rock. One of my favorite 'contemporary' bands is Pinback.

I like getting out and about when I can. There are so many great, beautiful places around Seattle to explore, hike, go camping, etc. I also enjoy traveling when I get the chance. I have been to Canada and Scotland and I'd like to visit many more places, take your pick.

I'm getting back into shape and I feel pretty good about it. I have a home gym where I work out about every other day. I'm also eating healthier; lots of vegetables and fewer carbs/sugar. I'm growing my own garden this year, too, so I'm excited about that.

So, yeah, that's a little about me, now how about you? Feel free to ask me anything, too. I look forward to hearing from you (ʘ‿ʘ)

title: Married Man Looking for Special Discreet Friendship
text:
Thanks for reading my ad and I am glad I caught your attention. I went back and forth with how I ought to title this ad and finally landed on advertising for a "special discreet friendship." This is my first foray into the world of seeking such a friendship since being married. I am simply interested in making my life a little more exciting, giving it an extra kick, having some intrigue. While I am still very much attached to my wife, the passion has somehow slipped away and my relationship has dulled over time. It is very comfortable, but not exciting. Do you feel that way? It may be that you and I just email each other some spicy titillating (although respectful) emails; it may be that we decide to discreetly meet and chat over coffee/tea, or maybe explore things further if we are both mutually inclined. There are lots of possibilities. As far as I am concerned, we can't go wrong...

I am a Caucasian man, tall, attractive, stocky, gym-goer, early fifties, advanced degrees, professional, live and work in San Francisco, clean-cut, respectful, and very discreet. I would love to hear from women -- married or single between the ages of 25 and 60 -- who, for whatever reasons, want to engage in a friendship in which all limits are respected yet at the same time exploration is in the cards (whether that be through e-mails, meet ups, etc.). I am honestly very open about how all of this might unfold. In the end, I do not wish to negatively impact my marriage and I don't want you (or your spouse/partner) hurt in any way; this is a very important value I hold dear and to which I am committed. 

I hope you are further intrigued by reading my ad and I hope to hear from you. I will reply to all who respond to my ad. Please tell me a bit about yourself (age, description, and any information about yourself that you would like to share) and what compelled you to answer my ad. What is your situation at the moment? What would you hope for out of a special friendship like this? I'll promise to get in touch with you soon.

I very much look forward to hearing from you... To know for sure that your email is not coming from a (ro)bot, please put the name of your favorite city in the subject line of your email. Thanks again and I hope to hear from you.

title: Looking for something somewhat out of the ordinary
text:
I have a strange never-ending natural curiosity in people, but not in the way that you might think. I don't really care about your job, what you had for breakfast, or even about the cool new bag you got... Don't get me wrong, I want to hear about those things too, but what I'm really interested in, is learning what makes you unique from everyone else walking down the street. 

My curiosity is usually focused on all the weird little quarks that people have. I want to know what your left eyebrow does when you get happy or nervous. I want to hear the fluctuation in your voice when you talk about something you are excited about. You get the idea...

Lately my schedule has been very erratic, so I am hoping to find someone (maybe you!) who would like to hang out at spontaneous times throughout the day. Maybe we grab lunch or coffee, or maybe we just relax somewhere and talk. Ideally I would like there to be some attraction, and I would like to play with the idea of getting to know each other physically, but without crossing any extreme lines (remember I'm partnered).

About you: Please be intelligent, interesting, fun, and open minded. Please also be somewhat close to my age range (22-44). I am particularly interested in women of Asian decent, so bonus points if that's you. I find myself curious about little cultural differences, and happen to be particularly attracted to them, but I am open to all races.

About me: I'm just your tall dark and handsome type (jk... sort of). I'm highly intelligent, adventurous, curious, and fun loving. I'm both introverted and outgoing. Most people say that they have never met anyone like me before. Most women find me very attractive. I am tall, lean/muscular, with long dark hair and light eyes. I typically have some facial hair, but not always. I'm 29 years old and white if that makes a difference to you.

I can't wait to hear from you!
replies with thought out content and photos will go to the top...

title: Doing stuff.
text:
It would be great to go to the movies, take scenic walks, dine out and just be spontaneous with someone who's open to living life without holding back. Ultimately I do want to meet "the one" and hey, if that happens here even better but that isn't at all what I'm expecting. 

I've only had one sb/sd relationship in my life and that lasted almost five years. It was mutually rewarding but like all good things it peacefully ended. As you can see I'm looking again for someone who equally loves adventure but can mix it in with a sexual arrangement. I love trying new things and it doesn't have to be all about sex but I do want that as part of the agreement. I'm sure you appreciate straightforwardness. 

I love a girl who can still wear heels when we stand next to each other. Don't count yourself out if you're petite :) I'm over 6ft, cute, tall and considered a handsome man. I'm disease free and will always try to make time for someone who's good in bed and a great friend. I'm looking for someone cute with a great personality, brain, and sense of humor! I'm looking for a long term friend with benefits, not just a one time, nsa thing. A weekly stipend is what I was thinking and I'm good for it.

If this is what you're looking for please share what your expectations for a stipend type of arrangement would be like? How many times a week do you think realistically you could meet up? Are you single? Is your place available some of the time or would we always have to come to my place? When you write feel free to ask me any questions you may have. Please tell me a bit about yourself as well as send some good pictures. I will be happy to answer anything and send pictures of myself.

When an attractive guy has an education and a good job, people ask why is he still single this late in the game? Girls ask specifically, "What's wrong with him?" I'll be perfectly honest. I've had back to back long term traditional relationships before having an arrangement and this is something that just works for me right now. I plan on settling down one day but the problem right now is that I work and travel a lot. 

I really, really like my job, and unfortunately it requires me to go places on short-notice. I do a lot of driving all over California and along the West. My schedule gets in the way of dating and this situation works perfectly for a student or someone who has equal needs. I don't think it would be an issue if I had a long-term girlfriend, but it's a big problem when you're trying to get past the first few dates just getting to know each other and the girl discovers that my schedule is just all over the map.

The girl I'm looking for is anywhere between 5'2''-5'9'' with blonde, brunette or red hair. She has blue, green or hazel eyes and is slim and takes care of herself. I'm open to HWP as long as you take care of yourself and stay healthy and active. I love a girly girl but also a girl who doesn't mind getting her hands dirty. I'm open to different ethnic groups. :) 

With all of this said, are you that someone who's open to a friend's-with-benefits scenario while being compensated for it? I'm pretty sexual and frankly it's difficult to find somebody who can accommodate my schedule. I think if we didn't expect a big emotional commitment from each other then maybe it would be simpler. I'm not really interested in being a "player." No games. To be honest, I'm not opposed if we do end up developing feelings for each other but that's down the road. Who knows what could happen....

title: Drive, And Cross The USA For Free!
text:
I didn't know where to post this because we are looking for something different, as you will see. 

We are two bicycle riders from the East Bay who plan on riding across the USA, from Santa Monica to St. Petersburg, Florida, starting in June 2016 and ending mid to late August. 

We are looking for a driver for a support vehicle and the driver can bring a friend for company/as a chaperone. We will pay all expenses for both of you, including air fare, lodging and food during the trip. 

We will drive to Los Angeles where we can stay for a couple of days to sight see if you would like (I have a large condo there). We then start our ride toward Palm Springs and on to the Grand Canyon (a wonder of the world and photos really do not do it justice). From there we will travel through such places as Flagstaff and Sedona, Arizona, Albuquerque, New Mexico (with its Native American culture), Santa Fe (one of the art capitals of the world), Carlsbad Caverns, Austin (probably the most progressive city in Texas), San Antonio (home of the Alamo and its river walk which doesn't rival Venice but is nonetheless fun), Baton Rouge, New Orleans (home of Cajun cooking and Mardi Gras) and finally St. Augustine (the oldest continuously occupied European settlement in the US). We will spend rest and visiting days in the more interesting places so it won't be just a "drive by" experience.

There will be boring stretches of vast expanses, but more importantly, you will have the chance to see more small town "Americana" than most Americans get to see while experiencing Tex-Mex food, parts of the "Old West," Louisiana, Florida and much more. We will take a different route driving back across the country to see different places, probably including Las Vegas. 

Because the two of us will be riding our bikes going to Florida, your driving will only be from 50 miles to at most 115 miles per day, with some days off for our rest and to visit places of interest. We would like you to do laundry once a week or so while we are riding as well as some food shopping and preparation (lunches, such as sandwiches) and help with planning our lodging and stops.

You need to be good natured, responsible, easy to get along with, be drug free and, of course, have a valid driver's license with no major violations. This is perfect for a college student, a recent graduate who doesn't yet have a job or possibly a teacher who wants to spend vacation time exploring.

title: Oedipus Complex
text:
Won't someone please tell me if the Oedipus Complex is a one-sided fantasy? Is it an exclusively male affair? Sure some girls want a "daddy" and enjoy being with a naughty older man, but I am talking about the mature woman on the side of the Oedipus Complex. 

I completely understand that most all women do not want a "baby" that they have to take care of, especially when searching for a lover. The OC isn't about that though, its about the taboo of the encounter. Its about the eroticism of two people doing something that is totally forbidden and would cause them to be ostracized by everyone they know. One quick glance at casual encounters will show all of the men looking for their "mommy" but few ladies are looking for their "son". To be clear, I in no way want to have this kind of relationship with my mother. But to act it out in a roleplay? To have a secret rendezvous that no one else can know about because it goes against nature? Maybe men really are just a bit more twisted inside.

title: Divorcing Sucks!
text:

You know you're both good people, you have deep love and respect for each other but it isn't right. Need someone to talk to? Why pay a therapist for a friend? title: Something real
text:
I'm not looking to give a 'woe is me' speech.. Life just handed me a big sack of lemons, and I hate the taste of lemonade. You ever have that feeling where one day melts into the next, this week is identical to the previous? Been going through that a lot lately.

Everyone's opinion might be different, but I happen to think I'm a smart, witty, fun, hopeless romantic... ISO someone who possesses those same qualities. I need someone who I can commiserate with or who is able to take my mind off the everyday BS.

Hopefully we can converse and keep one another mildly or even more than mildly amused. I'm not looking for the answer to the meaning of life. Just a reminder that life actually has meaning. I don't mind terms of endearment nor do I have disdain for pet names. I prefer paper over plastic in all senses of the words. I am a firm believer that you can meet the most remarkable people in the most unlikely of places. I don't do well with set topics. I thrive on randomness.

I generally would never consider posting an ad to connect with another human being. However there is something refreshing about the anonymity in this act that allows one to be completely be honest and free from judgement (well that that is the hope). I like to think of myself as silly and quirky. However, I am also sincere and kind. If you care to have a conversation with someone like myself, would you be so kind to send me an email? Also, after minor research I have noticed that the trend here is to request pictures, I do not find this necessary, as at this juncture, For now all I am seeking is conversation and empathy.

title: one altruist to another
text:
Lets keep a diary of ours thoughts and ideas on how to leave this world having made a long lasting and positive impact. Over time lets build and implement strategies to concretize the thoughts and realize those ideas. 

As I see it, we live in a world that's rampant with inequity, a world where selfish and inconsiderate people outnumber the kind and caring. A world full of people who wouldn't skip a heart beat while bulldozing anyone in their path to success. Lobbyist-puppets disguised as politicians are the norm. Armed with hidden agendas their only goal is to block all progress. Then, there are those that are hardworking. There are two types - those who work hard to ensure a few can build stockpiles of cash, and those who work hard selflessly for the welfare of others, for the betterment of this planet and to be good human beings. I want to be among the latter but I find myself increasingly becoming the former, after all I am a silicon-valley employee and that is how I earn my money! Be my support and I'll be yours while we transform ourselves into the hardworking kind of the latter type.

Even in this age of Facebook, Twitter and Youtube effecting change is a daunting task. Some people believe that technology can solve all our problems. They couldn't be more wrong. Some changes occur in a few years, some may take a decade and some others may take over a century. In my opinion, for one person to bring about change is almost impossible. Two is a team, with a few more we have a force, gather enough people and we have a revolution.

My goal is to build small-scale prototypes that produce concrete results and serve as models for larger scale implementations, which unfortunately may not be realized in my lifetime. I have some ideas of my own to share and would love to hear yours. Lets do something as a team, something to be proud of on our deathbeds. I don't seek fame or fortune, but I do seek the company of others to keep me motivated and on my toes, serving people and this planet every year, every month and every day for the rest of my life.

Recently I have had some good friends move away, get pregnant, or get really engrossed in new relationships where they are 24/7 with their new partners. As my group of friends who I regularly hang out with has dwindled, I realized that it has been really hard to make new friends! I see groups of girls out together who look like they are having a blast, but I think they would be a little weirded out if I came up to them and said "Hey! I'm a fun girl! Want to be friends?" So I'm turning to craigslist to hopefully find a new friend or two who would be up for hitting up a wine bar, hole in the wall restaurant or great local event. 

Some things I love: 
- Going to see live music. I'm pretty broad in what I like including indie, punk, brit pop, folk, soul, hip hop, jazz, etc. 
- Checking out new dive bars and new wine bars. I'm comfortable in both settings. 
- Cooking 
- Trying new foods and restaurants 
- Museums, art fairs, gallery showings, local events, etc. 
- Running and hiking
- DIY projects and crafts (up next, learning to knit)
- Wine tours, beer tasting, food events, etc. 
- Brunch 
- Deep intellectual conversations and conversations about nothing important
- People watching 
- Movies (I go by myself, but it would be nice to have someone to talk to about them after I see them) 
- Zany shenanigans 

Your age, race, and sexual orientation are unimportant to me... I'm just looking for someone who is interesting and fun. So if you are looking for a new best friend, regular friend, drinking buddy, or random conversationalist, please please email me.

title: 680 or 580?
text:
Due to various issues within the marriage (affairs from both sides and other external influences), our union has been totally without intimacy for a while. We have talked extensively about things, don't want a divorce, and most of the issues seem to be due to a lack of interest (not mine). She seems very unintersted in 'us' - its just all about the family. 

Anyways, I am married (for 22 years) with a lovely daughter who is the apple of my eye! 

I am a good looking guy whos in great shape; have many female friends who say I am a catch and very handsome. I have always been a very patient person with a lot of personal restraint. I thought this no sex thing would be a piece a cake - but am discovering that I did a great job surpressing my needs over the past 2 years - but feel like I can no longer do this and something has to give. 

In the past months - it seems like all that surpressed need is coming out at once and the frustration I feel is making want to pluck out my hair or yell. Working out has been a great release over the past 2 years - but even with my workouts getting longer (and erractic) and more vigorous -they are no longer cutting it. 

I am beginning to form some very nasty energy towards my wife due to the frustrations I am experiencing. We're civil most of the times - but I find myself trying to minimize our talks because I am afraid I might unleash on her and don't want to. 

At the same time - I am not in a frame of mind to talk constructively with her about my feelings (I am too pissed) and her response will likely be along the same lines as past conversations. My irrational thinking makes me suspect that she is either emotionally or physically (or both) involved with someone else. 

I am trying to stay in this and civil, if for nothing other than letting the kid get a bit older. They have a great family life right now and its most important to me to maintain this. I am a good person and don't back away easily from my committments.. OK - if you either are in a sexless relationship, or have survived one and are willing to share and let me bounce stuff off you, please reply (you will be my angel!). Bonus brownie points if you are in one and could use a support friend as much as I could - i would love to chat regularly and help lift each others spirits up from the hell this can be. 

Thanks for reading this far.. hope to hear back from you soon 

PS.. please put in "580" in the subject line so I know you are for real

title: Backpacking the Grand Canyon: 4/9-13
text:
Hey, I have a five night permit for the backcountry for two. As of now, I only have me going, as my camping partner has opted out. The places/dates are:
4/9 Indian Garden
4/10-11 Salt Creek
4/12-13 Monument Creek
4/14 hike out Hermits Rest
These are dates are immutable.

Anyway, I hate to waste a permit if somebody might like to go. Plus, I'd really like to split fuel costs with somebody. And it's nice to have somebody to talk to, though I don't mind solitude.

So, looking for someone who is available for that time, willing to rough it, possessing prior experience in backpacking, and physically fit. And someone that has the money to drive to AZ and outfit her trip and who really really wants to backpack the Grand Canyon.

I know this is not a lot of lead time, but there it is. Thought I'd put it out there anyway. I'm definitely going. If somebody else wants to go, she should email. No age limit, but be adult and super fit. I'm 45, I mountain bike, hike, run B2B every year. I did the GC two years ago and it damned near wrecked my hip. And yet I'm going back! Hiking the Canyon is not technical, but it can be strenuous. All your food will be carried on your back. Plus gear.

Tell me why you want to go, what kind of backpacking experience you have, what gear you own, how you stay in shape (I'm serious: you have to be in shape for something like this). Geologist+, good camp cook +, comfortable vehicle that you are willing to take to AZ ++ (otherwise it's an '88 Toyota pickup with no AC or radio). A photo would be appreciated, but the other stuff is more important. Ideally, you are in SF, Marin, or Sonoma, but if not, it's not a deal breaker.

Put "Grand Canyon" in the appropriate box, please, for obvious reasons.

If I like your email (if I get any at all), I'll contact and we can set up a meeting to see if it would work out. Have a good night, thanks for reading

title: thinker-writer-progressive 4 brain connexion
text:
"Old", wise, erudite, communicative guy whose heart's true desire is NOT "strictly platonic", but who knows better than to spend time looking for the near impossible, seeks stimulating wide ranging correspondence with a woman who'd enjoy the same.

No topical boundaries, no ideological rigmarole, no snooty attitude, and no lack of humor... just deep as well as light conversation about anything and everything under the sun and beyond... the more esoteric the better. It's an outlet, mental exercise, mutual education, a chance for contact in a world where contact of any kind is becoming more and more difficult and risky.

If you require anonymity that's fine -- although I don't. My objective is simply discourse, amusement, and stimulation. If anything more comes of it, it will be because we both agree that it's there to explore. This is not a ploy to find someone to date. You should share my lack of concern about age, appearance, location, relationship status, or any other physical details. I'm interested in a meeting of minds.

My life has many dimensions. I get plenty of physical and mental exercise, but it's typically solitary. This ad isn't likely to change that, but perhaps we'll feel a connection through ideas and words.

Be creative... be poetic... be sincere... be determined to express yourself freely.

Send me a note... I'll know from the word count whether we have potential.

cheers, blessings, peace, namaste, and whatever makes your life better!

title: A Dad Figure
text:
It's a bit different, I know, but I'm missing a dad-type person in my life. I never had one growing up and didn't think much about it, but curiously the impact of missing out on that role model is just now hitting me in my 40s. But you don't necessarily have to be older than me to fill the father role; it's in the attitude.

I'm looking for a man who is strong (mentally & physically), masculine, healthy & reasonably fit to do physical activities, 35-55, kind, educated, good-natured, has integrity, and single (my married friends have little time to get together). If you want companionship, someone you can show and teach your interests to, and you're left of center or willing to let politics alone, we may be a fit. I'm a 5'4" guy, go to gym, active, friendly, compassionate, sometimes childlike in a good way, playful sense of humor, loyal, want to spend time with a man I can look up to and respect. 

The level of mentorship is up to you...you can be a full-on Dad type and have guidlines, a more casual big brother, or something in between. I just ask that you take the lead in what we do, as I need to relinquish planning for a change. Does not need to be romantic/sexual; being friends is fine. Open to what you like...hiking, camping, kayaking, sports, beers, wine, live music, traveling, hanging out at home--almost anything. Pass on your knowledge/skill and have someone enjoy your world with you on your terms, and let's have fun together!

title: Want to see an MGM film from the mid '50s?
text:
These are my general interests: literature, personal growth/liberation, over-nite trips, animals, orchids, theatre, exotic/natural cuisine, nature (sun/surf, nude sunbathing) and its wild critters, estate sales, the Enneagram, robust humor, sex, and retreats.

Also: healthful life-style, chemical sensitivities, pre-'80s USA films, foreign cinema (view 2-3 flix nightly), Caribbean/European people, creative sex (I stretch backwards & you ingurgitate my jewels). Amenable 2 any activity that's focused on the front side of our bodies, massage (have table), self-disclosing conversation, swimming, "making out" by candle glow, helping you bake exquisite viands, that'll feed us after the shooot'ng subsides.

I like antiques: arbors, elder doggies, grand dads, gifted divas, architecture, the seas, values/sentiments. The Pyrenees is my birth place, educated in Florida.

Desirous of a serious, meaningful, and "old-fashion" relationship---not with a gelid intellectual. My personality/character make me significantly different from others in the Bay Area.

I want to be read to, in bed, do you? I've never owned a tv set---their voices ire me. Use no tobacco, dumbbells, or petrol-riddled fragrance. Marijuana, si Senorito. Trendiness passes me by.

If your response is too short, bromidic, or dumb, it'll be appropriately tossed. I hope this plan works well for you: We exchange 2-3 emales, I submit my phone #, you call, I reveal my precise address. If you are my type, you won't be pusillanimous about phoning. Let us simplify this tender rendezvous, eh? We meet at my hacienda...not at a cacophonous, players' cafe' that sells transparent cafe' with ersatz cream.

When we get better acquainted, & b4 we meet, I'll send my photo. I prefer men who are light-complexioned & hairy. However, this posting is about imminent friendship, & so your surface is not important to me unless it's unclean & emits vapors. Who knows who Mrs. Taggart is? Win a prize if you guess correctly. I assure you that I'll be flagged for not being conventional.

I've been a wee bit self-indulgent & self-sallying. You be too************let's have a non-toxic banquet.

I am an over-educated, professional guy. Eat and live healthy, practice yoga, spiritual, very laid back, Type-B with a Type-A job and travel schedule. Very extroverted, high energy, social drinker.

My 2016 New Year's resolution is to get out and meet more gay professionals. I'm personally interested in hiking, camping, outdoor activities, social events, retreats, and in exploring other opportunities as well.

title: Your Bucket List...
text:
I've experienced more in my life than most have imagined themselves getting the chance to at least try. I'm not bragging, I believe some to do with achievement, and much serendipity. Whatever the reasons, a few remain. 

Today I pondered how many rarely experience the realization of much that's on their list. So here goes perhaps another unanticipated chapter in life that happens just because. 

My posting is directed toward women because I believe my thoughts and spirit quicken more holistically with the soul of most woman. Mind and soul are critical elements that must harmonize for you and I to share in order to achieve convergence beyond even a personal level; beyond finding words for capturing tonalities of the essence of mind that escape as whimsically as they appear. 

No, I'm not a transcendental voyager, or lay claim to meanings of revelations more profound than they are real. What I believe I am blessed with is the capacity toward introspective awareness channeled through empathic sharing of the essential harmonies of life untold. In other words I often experience the deja Vu of things that may or may not occur -premonition of state without basis of their meanings. 

So if you're still with me after my ethereal journey, what my ambition here today is to engage with another toward achieving a significant experience that remain unfulfilled. Something in your bucket list that I may be so privileged to see and hear through your minds eye, that perhaps the two of us can embark on a quest to turn those thoughts into a shared and journeyed reality; a notch in your bucket list you never imagined would ever be there. Namaste!

Please share your thoughts with me!

title: Ideal friendship...different outcome. Read entire ad please :)
text:
Getting right to the point this is not facebook...so looking for just friends only here is not the #1 goal. I'm realistic so only respond to me if you can be realistic too. I know most guys online want that 'one thing' on everyone's mind. But I'm different. Honestly I want to take things to the sexual level I'm looking for with you first THEN mix friendship in, to make sure we click on that friendship level after hooking up. I do things my way, not the "normal" way. Try to follow along. Why meet for regular "dates" just to immediately assume that you don't click with someone only because you're so nervous? 

I like to have fun like most guys on these personals but I also like having deep conversations and making actual progress with someone along the way. So no I do not want what others want for their secret agendas; I want a guy that I can get to know a little first over the phone, go to your house to talk and hook up ON THE FIRST MEET, then be prepared to more than potentially have an on-going friendship with benefits if it's there. I'm more than capable of being real friends with real benefits, and am strongly looking for a guy who can be ready enough to follow my lead.

For hanging out I like movies, hiking, shopping, definitely clubbing, can do video games, walking around town, going out to local eateries to avoid fast-food and more. I'm 5'9 tall, masculine, average to thicker/stocky body build, short hair casual attire. Sometimes classy when going out but still masculine. I'm down to earth, funny, open-minded, outspoken, etc. Please be single and not currently attached to someone like your ex. Save the complications.

I do not send face pics, and I am not into judging looks or appearance. Too many people with fake pics and phony intentions, or robots who are simply pic collectors. We can talk on the phone, connect then just meet in person because I have nothing to hide so why try to stop at pictures? In fact I find that the best connections come from not having high expectations off of looks. Instead of being shallow, just be attracted to a personality, not a picture/looks. Race isn't important to me; however I do like being interracial whether it be friendship or more.... Clearly you should feel the same way. I only expect replies from guys who are open-minded about any race. In example, I love Latinos and Asians (yum) but if someone other than that is ringing my bell, then it is what it is :) For the record I'm a top looking for a submissive bttm to be down with who loves sex...and you be able host when we go further or for plan B in the car somewhere parked because I cannot host. Like under the stars chillin'.

Keeping in touch is key...We all have busy lives--you ARE NOT the only one with a busy schedule. If you say you want to meet, just fucking make the time for it and keep the plans. Or else stay the fuck offline. I cannot stress that enough. And back to pictures, it's annoying to exchange pictures with guys who can't follow through or keep the momentum going...if you're claiming to want even just a friend you should already have the time for them. By the way there's no sure way to tell if someone is a match on day 1. Real chemistry doesn't happen in 5 seconds, it happens over time after discovering there are general mutual interests. I want a guy who's prepared to meet with me a few different times before judging any chemistry.

The only real preference for FWB I have is age...I need a guy around my age who can keep up with me. So 18-29 hmu. But since it's a preference not a requirement, older guys feel free to be bold and hmu if you think we can still be good together :)

title: Underappreciated, overstressed and always giving or doing for others?
text:
Is life is pulling you in every direction and feeling overwhelmed and need a break? What better way to plug in, recharge and balanced than by a therapeutic, nurturing and pampering massage? 

For some this time year can be extra challenging. After all the holiday season celebrations are done, the New Year expectations, family demands, work overload or just life... can leave us feeling over stressed, lonely and blue.

What I offer is a place for you to share, be heard and understood. What you want and need is number important. What you feeling matters to me. You can relax, totally receive and totally let your hair down. You can feel empowered to be selfish and for it to be only about self care and self love just for you.

I am sensitive, empathic, nurturing and 100% unconditionally giving. I have been giving massage professionally for over 20 years and take pride in providing a safe place and service that is completely about you. I love what I do and right now I am humbly offer a sliding scale for those in need. I am not your average therapist and open and willing to work out what can serve your needs best.

My goal is to help uplift your spirits, create harmony mentally, physically as well as emotionally and to always be a place you can count on to be private, secure and discrete. 

Be sincere and real. No time for games or drama. Please tell me your favorite color for a response. I sincerely welcome you to reach out and allow me the opportunity to assist you in creating harmony and balance now and in the future.

Blessings.

title: Bizarro me
text:
Hi. I'm an asian engineer in my mid 30s, and all my coworkers in this male dominated industry are typically just like me, that is, book smart, clean cut indian or Chinese men. 

I'd love to get to know a new friend who's the opposite of me, whom I would have never met because our social circles would never otherwise overlap. I'm looking for someone who lives a different culture and life style, which may seem mundane to you but eye-opening to me, and vice versa. After all, experiencing different life styles make this journey called life more colorful, a la foreign exchange. So, do you have tattoos? Do you speak Spanish? Are you from Taiwan? Are you blonde? 420 friendly? Do you follow a potato based diet? Whatever it is, as long as you're different than me, I think you're cool!

In full disclosure, I'm not that exotic having come here from Hong Kong for over 20 years. But I'm sure my deeply rooted asian heritage and love for dim sum would be interesting to you. After all, if you aren't Chinese, you may feel awkward going into a Chinese restaurant. Am I right or am I right? :D

title: Seeking local activity partner (walks, hikes, running, etc.)
text:
I'd like to meet someone who is local (Vallejo, Benicia, American Canyon), who'd enjoy having a partner to do such things was walks, local hikes, or runs (if that's your thing, it's ok if not). I am posting this in strictly platonic, as I am not seeking more than a friend. I posted m4w, as I tend to have more female than male friends. Your age (and mine) shouldn't be that much of an issue, since this is platonic.

Sometimes, having an activity partner with whom to exercise can help in motivation, and can also make one comfortable taking a local hike, or even just walking.

I live in a nice part of Vallejo. Vallejo has a few decent neighborhoods for walking/jogging (and of course some bad areas). The waterfront can be a good spot. Mare Island has several great areas, with water views (on the back side, away from all the industrial stuff). Benicia State Park is nice (I have a permit to park free there). There are some interesting hiking spots on the hills across from Lowes. And, there's a neat and large county park (with amazing views) off the 80 about a mile north of Vallejo.

If having a friend to do such things potentially sounds interesting, then drop me a line, and let's talk. I would like to meet someone who is up for doing something active a few times a week. Assuming we get along, I'd like this to be a fairly regular thing.

If we develop a friendship, it might also be nice to have someone with whom to grab coffee, attend a local arts/Farmer's Market event with occasionally, and just do friend-type things. But, if we just are exercise partners, that's fine too.

So, I'd say we talk, meet for a walk down by the ferry building, and if we feel comfortable, we can plan some other walks (or a run/hike) and go from there.

Thanks!

title: WHERE DID THEY ALL GO???HONEST OPINIONS!!!
text:
HELLO,
....This a real post, from a real guy, with real questions.....Not desperate, just confused.....
........So, I want to know the truth about a few things I have been wondering about lately! I said, Hey let me throw it on Craigslist, because lots of people are on Craigslist and many different women get on Craigslist, so maybe I can get a collective value of opinions to go with and then I will know what the hell is going on?.....
.......My hope is women who are Single, married, separated or in a relationship will give their real opinion and be able to help out an attractive, fun and real guy who is wondering where the all the attractive, fun and real women have gone here in the Portland area
.......Okay so, what happened to all the women who are attractive, fun and real in the Portland and surrounding areas? There used to be so many! Women who loved life, lived life and did not sweat the small stuff, who were fun, adventurous, honest, real as hell and were also looking, wanting and hoping to meet and get to know men that were the same way?......Seems like most have ended up getting married or moving away. Or just turned to fake, to serious, drama filled men haters....LOL!......Seriously!!!......
.......I am a fun guy, have my shit together, attractive, love to laugh and joke around, fun as hell with alot to offer in every way. Country boy with a little city, I guess you can say a bad boy, without the bad man persona. Love life, work hard, know how to treat a women, affectionate, smart, and I have been told a kick ass guy!When it comes down to it, I am single and ready to meet someone cool, to just hang out with and get to know, no expectations, and see what could happen and where it may go!!! It used to be easy to meet women who wanted the same, and were actually real, honest and fun as hell.......
....Now it seems what we are meeting are women who are stressed, unhappy, no effort or time it takes to get to know someone, fake as hell and just not fun!...Not in any way am I saying all women we have met or that are out there, are like that or have been that way, but the percentage has been pretty high in the last few months and I and we are just wondering why???.......
......Are there any women out there that believe in friends first? Or women that are interested in good men who they can have fun with, get to know and are open to the possibilities????.........
**********************************************************************************
........So, women of any age (Age is just a number) who have an opinion, advice, a thought or feeling about any of this. Maybe women who are looking for the same and feel the same way as I and we do, but about men? Maybe women who can give the inside scoop, maybe what you see or just want to throw out their belief of what or where the real and fun women may be. Feel free to shoot a message or two! All I ask is for real women, with real opinions, that think they just may be able to help figure out what happened in the last few years here in the South Bay or every where for that matter, respond with your true, honest thoughts and opinions........
..........I am sending a recent picture with this post to just show I am a real guy and this is a real post.....
......Looking forward to hearing from all, and hell it may be a fun and adventurous way to help each other out, figure out what has changed and why it is so hard to find awesome and fun people who are looking for the same things that we all are looking for!!...............Please put your favorite drink or food in the Title so I know you are someone real.
....................Hope you had a great rainy Sunday!! Thank you for reading my post..........

title: Mom friends
text:
Hi all - 

As many times as I've tried this, I've had little luck with finding other moms who are GENUINELY interested in getting together for play dates, mom night outs, etc. And I really want to think I'm not the only mom out here who'd enjoy some other female companionship. 

A couple mom's who i aas really excited about responded to my last posting then fell off the face of the planet so hopefully whoever responds this time is really interested in a new friend...we're all busy ladies, so let's not waste each others time...anywho...

I am a 27 year old, married mommy of a 4 year old boy with baby boy #2 on the way :) I am educated, employed, opinionated, meat-eating, west coast transplant (from the east coast), honest, non-judgmental, ambitious, mouth like a sailor lol, 420 & drink friendly and tattooed. 

I'd love to plan outings and get togethers from park playdates, to fairs / festivals, groupon/ livingsocial activities, weekend trips, camping, shows, sitting at home doing nothing lol anything goes really - we're open and flexible!

I'm hoping to find at least ONE other mommy who feels the same and is willing to make time to create a TRUE & LASTING friendship!

I have an entrepeurnial spirit and it would be awesome if you did too so we could bounce ideas off each other and brainstorm? heated political debates? there is no topic that is taboo for me. In the near future, I'd also like a workout buddy to lose this baby weight - I'm most interested in boxing / kickboxing, tennis & zumba - but def open to other things...

I ask very little from mom friends but to be yourself and non-judgmental, not a flake & be willing to really make the time for a new friendship...these are the same things I'm offering - if based on my info you don't think we'd get along - then don't reply - simple as that. 

If you're attached, great! If not, that's fine too. 

If any of this sounds at all interesting to you then let me know and I'll respond asap...Hope to hear back soon!

title: Amazing customer service
text:
This was an email response I sent to a former post

I've worked at the library as a tech for about 15 years. A huge part of our day is taking care of patrons, both in person and on the phone, who come from a wide demographic. I've received many letters of praise from patrons which I'd love to share with you. I also received a yearly staff recognition award from the library for my excellent customer service.

I also design and make jewelry. I sell and show my work in shops and galleries, as well as direct sales. Running my own small business has encompassed a huge variety of skills.

Over the years I've had other small businesses, both by myself and with my sister. These included a gallery/store called Atelier Posey et Susan; as well as a personal assistant/errand business called go-for-it. As a personal assistant I had a variety of clients, including a psychologist who I did light research for, and a number of individuals who hired me a few hours each week for everything from party planning, home décor, and shopping, to bushiness calls and assisting a landscape gardener.

At times I've worked with SOMAR, an artist resource center who were responsible for putting up the stages at various street fairs. Although I'm a petite 5'1", this kind of physical work is very much within my capacity.

You can see, I've had a varied and interesting work history.

I look forward to meeting you.

title: Somehow, there is no joy...
text:
I am 40 something now...
and for whatever reason things that were bring joy before, don't anymore...
I run my business[es], run my errands, and hardly have any will power to get out there and play because somehow the game doesn't bring joy...
Ironically, I fix others' people lives... Can kick people out of depression, apathy, fatigues...
Yet, as I look at my life - all tactics seem to fail. As if something happen to my will power to look for the beauty in the randomness and recurrence... Everything seem to be a replay of the old, and somehow new eyes just don't "turn on". I can "fake it till I make it" with all the practices and exercises, yet...
I am still "gorgeous, brilliant, charismatic", as they say, and hardly care about any of it...
People and human perceptions, all conversations and activities feel like one big mush-up...
Where is the f-n joy?

title: Tahoe Ski trip with Alice 97.3 and Sarah & Vinnie Ritz-Carlton radio contest
text:
Shoot me your best offer, or trade. please read everything, especially the eligibility pics.

A chance to be my guest on a trip of a lifetime. I won a skip trip to go to Tahoe, CA (Truckee,CA) on the ALICE 97.3 Sarah & Vinnie morning Radio show. I don't have any friends out here that know how to snowboard or ski. The is put on by CBS RADIO. THIS IS A 100% legitimate auction.

PLEASE MESSAGE or text WITH ANY QUESTIONS. 
So you MUST know how to ski/snowboard, so I have someone to ski with. This NORTH STAR Resort is halfway up the mountain for an awesome Ski-in Ski-out experience. Five Star amazing vacation. 
 
Sit in on the live radio broadcasts AND the post show SECRET SHOW.  
About me:
I'm 25, Male, pretty outgoing, Caucasian, well educated, I'm a real down-to-earth laid back guy. I'm bringing my guitar for their jam sessions, so if you know how to play, that's great. I was a snow board instructor for 3 years, so I'd like someone that could keep up. 
 
About you:
Awesome, fun, guy/girl, older/younger, must ski/snowboard, if You play an instrument that's even better. Prefer a fan of the the show, probably someone from the Bay Area.
Make sure you read all the pics and description. If you don't ski, please don't bid. 
 
THE ONE DOWNSIDE IS THAT WE WOULD SHARE A ROOM, WITH 2 DOUBLE BEDS, kind of like an overnight camp getaway. I don't snore and I'm not picky at all, if you don't want to hang out at all that's cool too, we probably won't be in the room that much anyways. Just need a ski buddy and someone to enjoy this trip with and please don't be creepy or a murderer. 
 
This is not meant to sound like a personal ad, so please don't think it is. I don't care about your religious beliefs, sex, age (must be 21+), race or political views. 
 
Upon winning this auction, I will send you 2 forms that are required by CBSRADIO.COM, ALONG WITH A SCANNED PICTURE OF YOUR LICENSE, SO I CAN SUBMIT THEM TO THE PROMOTIONAL STAFF, BY THIS MONDAY.
 
I will be renting a nice 4-wheel SUV For the ride up. You can meet me at my apartment in Hayward, CA, or meet me at the Ritz-Carlton, up to you.
 
This is what I was sent....
 
Congratulations on winning a trip for two to party with Sarah and Vinnie at The Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe, courtesy of our friends at the Bay Club! Before we get the party started, here are some important things you need to know:
You must present a credit card upon check in (I will provide this). Any other incidental costs such as room service, the mini-bar, or any other purchases charged to your room will be your responsibility. Please note that The Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe is a pet-friendly resort. If you choose to bring your pet, there is a $250 one- time, non-refundable fee. This is your responsibility. Additionally, the day-rate for parking at the hotel is $39.
The Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe ski resort is situated mid-mountain on the Northstar California ski area and features ski-in, ski-out access in addition to the resort's many luxurious amenities and services. At The Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe, guests can enjoy all winter has to offer enhanced by:
• True North, the on-site ski retail and rental shop
• Personal mountain concierge services
• Complimentary gondola between the resort and the nearby Village at Northstar
California
Check in at The Ritz-Carlton in Tahoe is at 4pm on Wednesday, March 16, 2016. The hotel is located at 13031 Ritz Carlton Highlands Ct., Truckee, CA 96161
Here is a brief itinerary that outlines the highlights of your trip:
Wednesday, March 16, 2016
• 4p -- check in at the hotel
• 6p - Apres Ski Reception at Alpine Club (Located in Northstar Village) -- take the complimentary
gondola from the hotel to Northstar Village. The gondola schedule is included in this welcome letter.
Thursday, March 17, 2016 Sarah and Vinnie Live Broadcast!
• 6a -- 9a - Live Broadcast & Breakfast at The Pines -- Get ready for some St. Patrick's Day fun with Sarah
and Vinnie! Make sure you don't miss this morning's broadcast because the Bay Club will be passing out a special gift for all the Alice winners! And wear some green so you don't get pinched by Hooman!
• A short break after the broadcast - Sarah and Vinnie Record the Secret Show!
• Hit the slopes at Northstar California!
Friday, March 18, 2016 Sarah and Vinnie Live Broadcast!
• 6a -- 9a Live Broadcast & Breakfast at The Pines -- because when Sarah and Vinnie hit the road, they
don't do only one...but TWO live broadcasts. Please join us again for breakfast and a re-cap of Thursday's fun.
• Check out is at 11am on Friday, March 18.
Thank you for listening to Alice and for participating in the Sarah and Vinnie Party in Tahoe! Alice would like to also thank the Bay Club for their generosity in providing these trips and all the happy moments to be had at the Ritz-Carlton, Lake Tahoe! Thank you Bay Club!

title: Married, once married or in a LTR with a woman
text:
If you're a married man (or once were) or if you're in a long-term relationship with a woman and you'd like a discreet place to discuss your sexuality and form genuine friendships with similar men, please check out the "Married/Once Married Men's Group" that meets weekly at the Pacific Center in Berkeley. It's the only group of its type that meets in the Bay Area.

Although the group is primarily platonic, there have been times in the past when a long-term romance has developed between two members.

One thing the group is NOT is a place to find hook-up partners.

The group is anonymous and the confidentiality of all participants is protected. Current "regulars" range in age from 28 - 68 and the average number of attendees each week is nine. Meetings are every Wednesday night, from 8pm - 9:50pm. The Pacific Center is located at 2712 Telegraph Avenue in Berkeley.

I started attending more than three years ago when I was looking for feedback on coming out to my teenage kids. I didn't expect to attend more than once, but because the guys' feedback was so helpful, I returned to tell them how it went. I've been hooked ever since. I've found my tribe - there's no other social group like it. The dynamic is neither straight nor gay, it's somewhere in between.

I'm posting this information, not because the group needs more participants, but because it's a unique resource that hundreds of men have found invaluable throughout the group's 30+ year history.

title: Therapy Group in SF for gay men over 50
text:
Get honest and caring support. 
Explore possibilities. 
Develop direction in your life. 

I am a licensed clinical psychologist and have been leading therapy groups since the 1970s. There are one or two openings in the therapy/support group I lead on Thursday evenings in San Francisco, for gay men over 50. 

Issues discussed in the group include clarifying one's life goals; relationships with friends, family, and partners; finding meaning and connection; and the many other challenges of aging. The age range of the current group members is broad, from the late 50s through the 70s. The group meets every Thursday evening from 7:00 to 8:30 pm, in my office on Clement Street. There is a monthly fee.

I offer a no-cost in-person screening interview. 

Thank you!

title: Inescapable something
text:
You and I are both a little lonely. I know, its hard to swallow but truth is we have trouble connecting day to day. I'm not insulting or judging, just trying to have a different and honest interaction. I feel vulnerable admitting it, but I know if someone reaches out, they will be genuine, and something like that is nice. We both have that knowledge of one another. I'm not desperate and I'm not searching for 'the one'. I have a good life which lacks that inescapable something.

I love words and the positive impact they can have on our minds. I don't have ANY hidden agendas and I won't judge you and only ask the same in return...this is simply a way for me to escape for a little while. I'd prefer to converse with someone my own age, mostly due to the amount of pop culture references I will likely be sprinkling into our correspondence. We don't have to write every day. I'm not always available and I'm not expecting you to be either.

As an aside: We're trying to put forth the very best qualities (both personality-wise and physical appearance) of ourselves or perhaps trying to shine up those we think will appeal to others. Trying to conform to some un-achievable archetype that doesn't really exist. We all have flaws and quirks that make us unique - and I think we should embrace and own them. Yes?

While meeting in person is not always plausible, it doesn't preclude us from sharing a photo or two for curiosities sake - but we don't have to do that either. Sometimes the mystery is the best part.

Read this somewhere and found it so appropriate:

I don't know why I chose this road
as blind success turns to folly 
as doubt and fear become commonplace 
the stout hearted become circumspect
the truth of lies so freely told;
we friends are made of liars and cheats 
no safety in the hearts of friends
no truth from lips so stained with tears.

title: Quirky, whimsical, bookish
text:
Hello,

I'm more ingoing than outgoing, but not a total evil narcissistic dreamer. ;)

I have a complicated personality: intuitive and a thinker, analytical and poetic. I was a Philosophy major in college. I currently read and write poetry and fiction (I'm unpublished). I'm tall but not a jock or a bro. I'm much too gentle, sensitive, and communicative. An alpha male I definitely am not.

A bit of personal history that seems relevant: I had no actual friends throughout much of middle school and all of high school (I became a social invalid when puberty hit); my introversion flourished unchecked and I became withdrawn. As a result, I acquired so-called mature social skills late. To this day, to be honest, I continue to struggle to make and keep friends (and to marvel at how difficult and complicated communication and connection with other people can be, which does not mean I don't think it's worth it.) 

Things I enjoy doing in the company of another:
I enjoy walking (wandering, really), talking endlessly (endlessly verbalizing experience -- philosophizing and psychoanalyzing about self and society), reading out loud, and so on. I enjoy throwing a frisbee. Tennis is fun, too, though, honestly, it's been a while. And I jog.

If you found any of the above appealing, please feel free to write me a message. If you could, please let me know what specifically leapt out at you in what I wrote.

Thanks for reading. Peace.

title: Good, quality friends
text:
Hello to the colorful Craigslist community! I'm looking for something somewhat specific, but most importantly I'm looking for good, quality friends. 

My lifestyle has changed pretty drastically over the last year. I've met my soulmate and I've fallen in love, but he comes two for the price of one, as he has the sweetest 3 year old son, who I've also fallen for completely. I'm only 21, and sometimes I yearn to go out and get wasted and dance like most other 21 year olds. . . and there is totally room for that in my friend relationships, but, it's also important that you're not a psycho, and can hang with a toddler, or at least handle a friend who is less available at the drop of a hat.
I've got a range of interests, but mostly I'm into self improvement, live music, and bougie weed. I'm taking a semester off of school, as I'm about a year from graduating with a business degree but decided that I can't do it because it's an evil culture. . . Hippie shit, I know. Funnily enough, I'm thinking of going back for a BS in environmental studies. 
My boyfriend is a software engineer, and recently quit working at his last startup job to pursue his own thing. He is also very into meeting new friends. He too has awesome taste in music, is a fan of the ganja, and is a recent Alabama transplant who has a huge heart and lots of interesting, intelligent opinions. Let me know about yourself if you think we'd vibe well together. We can meet up for drinks or something.

title: Married Man Looking for Special Discreet Friendship
text:
Thanks for reading my ad and I am glad I caught your attention. I went back and forth with how I ought to title this ad and finally landed on advertising for a "special discreet friendship." This is my first foray into the world of seeking such a friendship since being married. I am simply interested in making my life a little more exciting, giving it an extra kick, having some intrigue. While I am still very much attached to my wife, the passion has somehow slipped away and my relationship has dulled over time. It is very comfortable, but not exciting. Do you feel that way? It may be that you and I just email each other some spicy titillating (although respectful) emails; it may be that we decide to discreetly meet and chat over coffee/tea, or maybe explore things further if we are both mutually inclined. There are lots of possibilities. As far as I am concerned, we can't go wrong...

I am a Caucasian man, tall, attractive, stocky, gym-goer, early fifties, advanced degrees, professional, live and work in San Francisco, clean-cut, respectful, and very discreet. I would love to hear from women -- married or single between the ages of 25 and 60 -- who, for whatever reasons, want to engage in a friendship in which all limits are respected yet at the same time exploration is in the cards (whether that be through e-mails, meet ups, etc.). I am honestly very open about how all of this might unfold. In the end, I do not wish to negatively impact my marriage and I don't want you (or your spouse/partner) hurt in any way; this is a very important value I hold dear and to which I am committed. 

I hope you are further intrigued by reading my ad and I hope to hear from you. I will reply to all who respond to my ad. Please tell me a bit about yourself (age, description, and any information about yourself that you would like to share) and what compelled you to answer my ad. What is your situation at the moment? What would you hope for out of a special friendship like this? I'll promise to get in touch with you soon.

I very much look forward to hearing from you... To know for sure that your email is not coming from a (ro)bot, please put the name of your favorite city in the subject line of your email. Thanks again and I hope to hear from you.

title: Senior, Serious, Silly, Simple, Sincere
text:
If you are age appropriate and live in SF, this offer is one to read and, hopefully, accept. I am a 74 year old retiree, to whom the above traits apply, who wants to meet a woman in SF to explore the possibility of friendship.

Ads on CL often seem unrealistic, if not unreal. As one who finds fantasy and frivolity fulfilling, the criteria many specify are either too sparse or so elaborate that no one is likely to meet them all. Instead, despite high standards and lofty expectations, I choose to be purposely vague, and open-minded in lieu of excluding a woman whose toe nail polish is not the color or texture I prefer. Believing opposites need not conflict, but can, and do, attract, I leave the door wide open. Matters like heritage, race, etc. are neither assets nor liabilities. Tolerance reigns.

My biography and intimate details are not for public display, but, with the right woman, enough is available to remove any doubt about whether we could be compatible. For this purpose, please believe I am a good person, but not so good as to lack faults or room to learn, grow, and improve. If this applies to you, as well, then we should have enough in common upon which to consider getting in touch, if not more.

Pictures are things to behold, but I never elicit or give them since they tend to reflect the artist better than the subject. Further, the qualities that matter most cannot be portrayed in visual media. I recognize appearance is important, but what is critical to me are things such as character, honesty, integrity, etc. Also, I disbelieve self-assessments of intelligence, preferring humility and modesty. No one respects intelligence or wisdom more than me, but I find arrogance and over-confidence repelling.

This post is a means to the goal of friendship. It is not a request for a pen pal, playmate, or anything else. If it beckons you, your reply is welcome. If not, so be it. Either way, I wish you success in finding someone suitable. Thank you for reading.

title: Married, once married or in a LTR with a woman
text:
If you're a married man (or once were) or if you're in a long-term relationship with a woman and you'd like a discreet place to discuss your sexuality and form genuine friendships with similar men, please check out the "Married/Once Married Men's Group" that meets weekly at the Pacific Center in Berkeley. It's the only group of its type that meets in the Bay Area.

Although the group is primarily platonic, there have been times in the past when a long-term romance has developed between two members.

One thing the group is NOT is a place to find hook-up partners.

The group is anonymous and the confidentiality of all participants is protected. Current "regulars" range in age from 28 - 68 and the average number of attendees each week is nine. Meetings are every Wednesday night, from 8pm - 9:50pm. The Pacific Center is located at 2712 Telegraph Avenue in Berkeley.

I started attending more than three years ago when I was looking for feedback on coming out to my teenage kids. I didn't expect to attend more than once, but because the guys' feedback was so helpful, I returned to tell them how it went. I've been hooked ever since. I've found my tribe - there's no other social group like it. The dynamic is neither straight nor gay, it's somewhere in between.

I'm posting this information, not because the group needs more participants, but because it's a unique resource that hundreds of men have found invaluable throughout the group's 30+ year history.

title: I just want someone to share my life with
text:
So I just binge-watched that show Love on Netflix and I really relate to Mickey's character. I feel fuckin empty. I don't have anyone to share my life with! It sucks. I'm a 31 year old chick who has a job and free-time but no one to indulge my bullshit. I invested so much time in friendships that I thought would last forever. Does anyone even want that anymore? I remember my best friend said we should be best friends forever, no matter what. And that was fucking amazing to me. And I was so in. For some reason the universe took my friend away from me RIP. Others have come and gone. I still miss my friend. Every fucking day. I mean remember in junior high when you could just walk up to someone and be friends because you both had Nirvana written on your backpack? Why can't things be simple? Where does a 31 year old woman make friends? I'm a recovering addict so I don't really drink or go to bars and I'm not into dance clubs. I'm really into punk shows or any concert for that matter but I'm scared to go by myself. But I love music. I play a bunch of instruments. I've been playing piano a lot lately but I play guitar mainly. I've been in some bands. I'd love to play music with some people. I just like genuine people who are positive. I'm a cynical person, I can't help it. But if you're a cynic as well it's cool. Anyone up for just talking and maybe becoming friends if we gel? I used to go to NA and that was a great support system for me but I smoke weed now so I feel like a fraud being in there.
Here are some of my favorite albums..
Against me! - Reinventing Axl Rose
Weezer's Pinkerton
Buzzcocks Singles Going Steady
Up Against The Legends
King Tuff Was Dead

And there's some upcoming shows that sound cool. Let's paint this fucking town RED!
On 3/23 coheed and cambria are playing.. And although they kind of suck now I love their first 2 albums. The smashing pumpkins are playing an acoustic set on 3/25.. That would be epic right??
And Yuck is playing 3/26. Are they still good? I don't even know but I love their first album.
Pansy division and kepi ghoulie are playing at Gilman on 4/1. I used to see the groovie ghoulies all the time in high school so that'd just be a funny show. And on 4/2 this band audacity from Orange county is playing. They're fucking awesome live and it's at thee parkside. On 4/9 terry malts are playing. Theyre aight. But it's a cheap show and should be fun. And last but not least, nofx is playing 4/12. I loved them in high school and they're hilarious live.
I hope this post isn't annoying. I just wanna do shit! And I can fly solo as a lone wolf but I'd rather have some company. So let's chill. 😙💨✌️
Oh and if you don't know what the fuck I'm talking about in this post don't email me. My hope is to find some folks with similar interests: Rock & Roll, vinyl, love, shows, Wes Anderson movies, thrift stores, adventures, flea markets, bicycles, rainy days, children's hospital, etc. And I'm not looking for a random hook up either. This isn't a vain shallow thing. I just want sincere friends.

bueno, bueno, pasemos al negocio. . . digo, a lo que te truje chencha.

bueno, quiero decir, que escogeré sabiamente a esa reina que quiera compartir sus quincenas con este chamacón.

I'm looking for a non smoking reasonably handsome regular-joe type guy to cuddle up with and watch a crappy B movie or whatever VHS or DVD you have lying around.

Blue-collar lookin' hairy man (or men) would be a bonus, but not a deal breaker. BO, bad breath, or excessive weight is a deal breaker. Age not really a factor.
I'm a youthful 42, if that matters. 5'11", 160. More photos available.
I'm quite honestly just looking for someone who doesn't mind being just a bit more affectionate than the usual repressed American male. This is not a sex ad. There's got to be someone out there who could use a little innocent affection.
That too much to ask? Be forewarned, I'm a devoted friend, so if we hit it off, it may lead to many evenings and weekends well spent. 
I do ask for a description of your stats, a photo, and anything else you'd like to include about you.
