title: 680 or 580?
text:
Due to various issues within the marriage (affairs from both sides and other external influences), our union has been totally without intimacy for a while. We have talked extensively about things, don't want a divorce, and most of the issues seem to be due to a lack of interest (not mine). She seems very unintersted in 'us' - its just all about the family. 

Anyways, I am married (for 22 years) with a lovely daughter who is the apple of my eye! 

I am a good looking guy whos in great shape; have many female friends who say I am a catch and very handsome. I have always been a very patient person with a lot of personal restraint. I thought this no sex thing would be a piece a cake - but am discovering that I did a great job surpressing my needs over the past 2 years - but feel like I can no longer do this and something has to give. 

In the past months - it seems like all that surpressed need is coming out at once and the frustration I feel is making want to pluck out my hair or yell. Working out has been a great release over the past 2 years - but even with my workouts getting longer (and erractic) and more vigorous -they are no longer cutting it. 

I am beginning to form some very nasty energy towards my wife due to the frustrations I am experiencing. We're civil most of the times - but I find myself trying to minimize our talks because I am afraid I might unleash on her and don't want to. 

At the same time - I am not in a frame of mind to talk constructively with her about my feelings (I am too pissed) and her response will likely be along the same lines as past conversations. My irrational thinking makes me suspect that she is either emotionally or physically (or both) involved with someone else. 

I am trying to stay in this and civil, if for nothing other than letting the kid get a bit older. They have a great family life right now and its most important to me to maintain this. I am a good person and don't back away easily from my committments.. OK - if you either are in a sexless relationship, or have survived one and are willing to share and let me bounce stuff off you, please reply (you will be my angel!). Bonus brownie points if you are in one and could use a support friend as much as I could - i would love to chat regularly and help lift each others spirits up from the hell this can be. 

Thanks for reading this far.. hope to hear back from you soon 

PS.. please put in "580" in the subject line so I know you are for real

title: Monterey Bay Aquarium & Dinner
text:
Do you feel like hitting up the aquarium and having a pleasant lunch or dinner? Also down to hit up the SF zoo instead if that sounds better. (My treat) 
I try to make it out to these places at least once every couple years or so.

I'm 33, handsome, in great shape and fun to hang out with. Love meeting new people. I have lots of friends but none have the time, motivation or the same interests that I have. Kind of tired of the same old routine day in and day out. Not looking for a serious relationship. Not trying to include children in the plan (sorry).
I'm the outdoors kind of guy, young, goofy and love nerdy/educational kind of fun :) I love the beach and nature walks/hikes, animals and looking up at the stars. I love the silence and peacefulness of early morning before the rest of the world wakes up for the day. I love good and honest people.

Please be between 25-36 years of age, adventurous and outgoing with a positive attitude. I prefer people who are more enthusiastic and ready to fly rather than timid and shy. Yes...I just rhymed in my post.. Hehe! 

My list of "no's":
No guys
No social media
No flakes/fakes 
No bringing a friend along
No drugs but we can get drinks when we are out

why not meet a girl in person..you may ask? For a few reasons, actually.. 1 is that people are kinda off stand'ish in person and going right up to people with this specific request isn't as easy at it was 10 years or so ago. 2 is that in person it's hard to tell a girl's age and I'm looking for someone close to my age. 3 is that doing it this way has worked in the past (making good friends). And 4 is that most girls are married or just not available, and if you are responding to this then that means you are probably actively looking for the same things as I am. It just works out better this way...theoretically... we'll see what comes of it.
so that's my reasoning.

Let's do a little picture swap and talk. Then we can plan a day trip if we click.

Sound good?
Thanks for reading :)

I'll settle for someone to chat with occasionally, possibly even have a burger and some pie at the Nations nearby. Or possibly you need a place to live while getting your life back on track? Or maybe you'd like to own a house and are willing to work out an exchange for this house instead of having me leave it to the state when I die?

What am I looking for? Well honestly I've no idea. All I know is that I'm tired of just sitting around waiting for something to happen. Dislike being alone, but haven't any friends left since they've all moved, died, or gotten wrapped up in their own family life. What I can say for a certainty is that I'm not on CL looking for sex! Given how much pain I receive from my back, any exorcise (including horizontal) is not something I have any interest in!

Maybe I'm just venting, or possibly I might find someone out there wanting to talk. Might could be we could even be an occasional luncheon buddy? 

Drop a note and tell me about your life, or tell me what I might do to change mine.

title: It has been said that 75% of marriages end in devorce
text:
So statics show that 75% of marriages in the US ends in divorce, which is up from 50% about 15 years ago. Which means that 25% of married people are happy in their marriage, which if you think about it is not a lot of people. We spend a lot of time and money on getting married, we stand up and make promises to each other and in front of friends and family as wall as a higher power which for me is God. I have been down this road before when I was 21 and that did not end well and now I am trying it for the second time, I am a point where I am let's just say on the fence about things. We all have our little things we do that make us who we are, but it seems to get lost in marriage as much as we want to keep it. I thought I was marrying one person and now I am finding a total different person which I assume my wife is too. When two people make that commitment it becomes a we and not I, everything we do is for each other and should make both people happy. What I am finding is a lot of promises are being broken may be not on purpose but yet they are. I assumed that talking about it and pointing things out would help, but the seem to make things worse, I am feeling more resentful, and frustrated, after I bring things up and nothings changes.

So my question for all of you out there how you handle it, or do you just quit and give up. There is nothing wrong with quitting, but we must first give it our best shot. So how is your marriage, if you are unhappy then why are you staying together? I have been amazed at how my parents have done it for all these years, they have been married for over 60 years and seem to be happy. I have tried talking to my mother about it, but she does not want to get evolved, and I have tried talking to my friend, but not sure what she can do sense her and her husband are arguing and fighting about 95% of the time. I secretly hope they get divorced, I think she would be better off with out him and was against it from the start. I only am friendly to him for her sake. So anyway fell like talking about your marriage? Let me know.

title: It has been said that 75% of marriages end in devorce
text:
So statics show that 75% of marriages in the US ends in divorce, which is up from 50% about 15 years ago. Which means that 25% of married people are happy in their marriage, which if you think about it is not a lot of people. We spend a lot of time and money on getting married, we stand up and make promises to each other and in front of friends and family as wall as a higher power which for me is God. I have been down this road before when I was 21 and that did not end well and now I am trying it for the second time, I am a point where I am let's just say on the fence about things. We all have our little things we do that make us who we are, but it seems to get lost in marriage as much as we want to keep it. I thought I was marrying one person and now I am finding a total different person which I assume my wife is too. When two people make that commitment it becomes a we and not I, everything we do is for each other and should make both people happy. What I am finding is a lot of promises are being broken may be not on purpose but yet they are. I assumed that talking about it and pointing things out would help, but the seem to make things worse, I am feeling more resentful, and frustrated, after I bring things up and nothings changes.

So my question for all of you out there how you handle it, or do you just quit and give up. There is nothing wrong with quitting, but we must first give it our best shot. So how is your marriage, if you are unhappy then why are you staying together? I have been amazed at how my parents have done it for all these years, they have been married for over 60 years and seem to be happy. I have tried talking to my mother about it, but she does not want to get evolved, and I have tried talking to my friend, but not sure what she can do sense her and her husband are arguing and fighting about 95% of the time. I secretly hope they get divorced, I think she would be better off with out him and was against it from the start. I only am friendly to him for her sake. So anyway fell like talking about your marriage? Let me know.

title: Seeking Advice
text:
I am need of some serious advice. This is strictly platonic. I do not seek anything else. Please do not flag this, I am really serious.

I am a 20 year old male. I have had a few serious relationships, took things slow, built a friendship and went from there. No relationship has lasted past the first few instances of sexual interaction. 

Two years ago I also developed a symptom that earlier this year was medically diagnosed as hyperspermia. 

In short, my body produces semen at an abnormal rate that makes me produce large amounts every time I ejaculate. I am serious. I don't mean that I produce "large" amounts as is the guy with the big inflated ego that thinks he's hot stuff. When I say I have been medically diagnosed, I am for real. I have been to the hospital (male urology dept), where I undertook a series of tests. I had to give samples twice a day, three times in a week, over 5 days. Whereas the average male produces around 1 teaspoon of semen, I consistently produced between 7 and 8 teaspoons, hence the hyperspermia diagnosis. 

In my personal life, this has been horrible. Every girl I've been with hates it. I makes messes. I overfill condoms (making dangerous messes, reproductive-wise), and have lost every relationship in the last two years. Girls think I'm a freak and I've been accused of taking drugs or supplements to make this happen. I don't.

Am I doomed? Will I never have a girl take me serious? Are all girls grossed out by this? I don't blame them. Like I said, I make a huge mess. It's embarrassing and I'm ashamed. Am I doomed? Does anyone know what I can do?

Any advice is greatly appreciated. 

Thank you,

James.

title: Sexual expression group
text:
Hello men of craigslist,

We feel that it's important that in 2016 women should have a platform to freely express themselves sexually without barriers and without judgment. Terms like slut-shaming should be something of the past and we really want to promote sexual positivity. That's where you come in, we are currently looking for men to facilitate this platform as we feel that they are most inclined to be interested by the prospect. It comes down to you ask personal sex questions in a platonic fashion, to the girls involved. This will involve certain standards and requirements which I will list below:

-Must have a Facebook account since this is where the online platform is created. We will send you our accounts so that you can message us only if you feel comfortable. Only Facebook messenger is required, the messages are between you and each girl. Nobody else can see them, it's as discrete as you want it to be.
-Must be willing to listen to feedback and able to follow instructions. There is a certain standard that comes with this mini-revolution and it's important to us that that remains. You are not expected to do amazing right away but you need to be willing to take criticism to improve.
-Must be open-minded, we all have very different interests, sexual experiences, personalities and desires in general. We don't allow racism, sexism or any other form of discrimination. We don't expect you to be into everything that will be discussed but you need to be willing to talk about it.

All girls are physically attractive, intelligent and liberal around the ages of 19-25.
Type Liberal in the subject line so we know you're not a spammer.

title: Later that evening...
text:
...Betti stepped from her car after her meeting with Doc Raisonheimer. The meeting went well, she was able to bring the doc up on her work life and she explained how she was joking about resigning, but not about the trying events of the past few days. It was always nice to speak with Doc, away from the fears of rumors and office gossip.

The house door flew open upon her third step toward the front door her eldest Cindy came running into her arms.

"Mom, they got us tickets to go see the ballet!"

"What are you talking about Cindy?" Betti asked as she returned Cindy's hug, arms encircling Betti's legs firmly.

"They got us tickets! And Frances is dancing Mom!" Cindy loved the ballet and had already told her Mom that it was New York or London, no other ballet companies would do. Betti gave Cindy all the support and encouragement she could muster, but was frequently concerned about disappointment. She sometimes reminded Cindy that at 5 years old, there were a few years of practice that awaited her New York acceptance.

Her husband appeared in the doorway with a sort of wry smile and stepped into Betti's inquiry. 

"Cindy says we have tickets to the ballet?" 

"Sure do," her husband responded. "Apparently Yutz and Franklin felt bad for messing with you a bit so they got together and treated us to an evening out. We all have tickets to the ballet and dinner at Jardiniere is compliments of both Yutz and Franklin, not the company. 

A limo will be here in an hour and a half."

"Messing with me?" Betti asked, brow in a furl.

"Something about Sally and a coffee cup?" her husband asked unknowingly, shoulders shrugging.

title: 30 yr old musician seeking possible room
text:
Hi friends! My name is Bobby and I'm looking for a room to rent. I thought I'd post this in the platonic section of the personals too and see what came up. Lots of people might have spare rooms and be open to renting them but not actively looking at the room wanted section of Craigslist. If this isn't you, that's okay...but if it is, I hope it works out!

I'm a friendly, no drama, gay male, just turned 30, mature, easy-going. I pay my bills on time, no pets, etc. I'm a professional singer/songwriter by trade, and will be gone on tour quite a lot, but I'm quiet when home. Don't let musician stereotypes turn you away from a good tenant. :) I don't do drugs, barely drink, don't smoke, make a decent living doing what I love, and you probably won't hear a sound from me.

Only mentioning the gay-friendly part because I want that to be the least of my worries. Not looking for a relationship right now - not closed off to one in the future, but it's just not on my priority list.

As far as what I'm looking for, I'm hoping for a quiet room with a bathroom to myself. Happy to share the kitchen. A separate entrance would be a huge plus, but not a must. An opportunity for storage in the garage or otherwise for CDs and a few other things would also be a huge plus. I have a car, but usually park it on the street anyway. Quiet neighborhood is a must for me. 

I'm hoping to pay between $600 and $800 per month for everything (rent, utilities, etc.)

Okay, so that's me! Hoping for a room nearby to Petaluma if possible - not against going farther out (novato, santa rosa, etc), but I love our sleepy little town here and would hate to leave it. Feel free to reach out if you're farther away too, though. I'm open to most options. 

Thanks for reading and hope to hear from you soon!

Best,
Bobby

title: Can you get away tonight? Let's have a drink!
text:
Hey there!

Has your marriage become a drag? Are you craving a fun/romantic night out? Feeling daring? Can you keep a secret? Think you can get away this weekend?

Let's have dinner! I'm buying :)

You: Involved, any race, any ethnicity, any reasonably compatible age (let's say 35 - 55), any height (beauty in the eye of the beholder, right?) non-smoking, able to walk up 100 stairs without dropping dead, clean, loves bathing, sane, safe, smart, politically-left, curious, and willing to share secrets that will be kept under lock and key.

Me: Also involved, Caucasian, 40's, handsome (I'll let you decide), nearly 6 feet, average build, brown eyes, med European complexion, sometimes light facial hair, (sometimes none), shaved head, non-smoking, no substance-abusing, clean, smells nice, perfect medical records, intelligent, witty, sarcastic, creative, imaginative, gentle, fun, daring, polite and cordial, craving your companionship.

Imagine this . . . You and I are on a business trip with our companies. We don't know each other, but have seen each other pass in the hotel lobby. We just happen to be dining separately, alone, and decide to sit together instead.

So let's do it! Your favorite place and my treat! Even all dressed up, if that's what you'd like. We can have a wonderful conversation (I'm a complete gentleman!!), sharing stories (I have many), and end the evening one of two ways . . . 1.) A bid farewell, with a thoughtful hug, as if saying goodnight to an old friend. Or 2.) Extending it a bit with an undetermined interval of time, and a kiss, which just might get our hearts racing. I'll leave that up to you though.

Still with me? Am I asking for too much?

Send something interesting in the subject field and a photo (your secret is a billion% safe with me) so I'll know you're real and not a spam reply. And since time is of the essence, tell me a quick story, attach a picture, and tell me where you'd like to meet. I reply and we'll go from there ... 
Until then ...

title: one altruist to another
text:
Lets keep a diary of ours thoughts and ideas on how to leave this world having made a long lasting and positive impact. Over time lets build and implement strategies to concretize the thoughts and realize those ideas. 

As I see it, we live in a world that's rampant with inequity, a world where selfish and inconsiderate people outnumber the kind and caring. A world full of people who wouldn't skip a heart beat while bulldozing anyone in their path to success. Lobbyist-puppets disguised as politicians are the norm. Armed with hidden agendas their only goal is to block all progress. Then, there are those that are hardworking. There are two types - those who work hard to ensure a few can build stockpiles of cash, and those who work hard selflessly for the welfare of others, for the betterment of this planet and to be good human beings. I want to be among the latter but I find myself increasingly becoming the former, after all I am a silicon-valley employee and that is how I earn my money! Be my support and I'll be yours while we transform ourselves into the hardworking kind of the latter type.

Even in this age of Facebook, Twitter and Youtube effecting change is a daunting task. Some people believe that technology can solve all our problems. They couldn't be more wrong. Some changes occur in a few years, some may take a decade and some others may take over a century. In my opinion, for one person to bring about change is almost impossible. Two is a team, with a few more we have a force, gather enough people and we have a revolution.

My goal is to build small-scale prototypes that produce concrete results and serve as models for larger scale implementations, which unfortunately may not be realized in my lifetime. I have some ideas of my own to share and would love to hear yours. Lets do something as a team, something to be proud of on our deathbeds. I don't seek fame or fortune, but I do seek the company of others to keep me motivated and on my toes, serving people and this planet every year, every month and every day for the rest of my life.

title: Relationship Ended / Possible Friendship Advice Needed
text:
I'll be brief here, but can go into details if someone wants to help.
I'm really feeling bad, and could use someone to chat with.

Back in 2006-2008, I was in a 2 1/2 year relationship.
Our relationship was a bit rough at times, because he was questioning who he was.
He cheated at least twice (three times if you count below) and wanted to break up twice.
We did manage to stay together, and he did grow and start to find out who he was.
He even came out to his parents over the spring/summer.

Over the summer, my BF at the time was on gay.com chatting with people.
He ended up talking to someone...
He wasn't talking to me as much, our communication wasn't the best...
I tried reaching him in September several times, but he never responded to my IM's.
Well, in October, he met this guy...
spent the weekend, and ended up getting his stuff and moving in about a week after they met.
Within two weeks or so, they bought commitment rings.

He finally called me end of October... telling me he moved out.
I called back the next day, and told him how I felt about him,
and how hurt I was. Long story short, he finally realized I meant it when I told him I loved him.

I drove to see him and his BF, and try to be friends.
Since then, everything has been akward...
I mean, he "overshares" on some personal details about their relationship. After I went there, he was saying he was 50/50 on staying and leaving...
not that I would try to win him back... that's a decision for his heart to make.

Lately, he's telling me this guy is "the one", and how great everything is.
The problem is that every time I talk to him, he's always talking about himself, "me me me", and "him and his BF".
He never really cares about what I'm up to or doing.... if I say something, I get "oh, ah, ok" responses.

He never got his driver's license.... so a few weeks ago, I picked him up and he stayed with me for four days. We got along quite well, and our communication was better than ever. He even mentioned we talk much better now, and he enjoyed our conversations. But, he would say inappropriate things like "you're cute when you're angry"... or letting him give me a back/neck/shoulder massage and foot rub in bed... then asking the next day for me to do it again. We seemed to connect a bit, but he's with his new BF.

My feelings are pretty deep for him, and he wants to be friends.
He really valued our relationship, and in some ways, we still have a very strong bond.
But, at the same time, he makes me feel like I'm his security blanket.
I'm stepping back and I need space...

Fast Forward, 2013
I got strange messages on gay.com from someone I did not recognize. Long story short, his bf, now his ex, was asking me questions about my ex. They broke up. One day, not only did he tell me they broke up, he did it in such a way, I felt it was a very bad breakup. He told me my ex (who has only been with men his entire life) is now seeing a woman.

I decided to go to his parents house, to tell his mom "if he needs someone to talk to..."
What a mistake, I knocked on the door and my ex answers. He recognized me, and gave me a hug. He invited me in, and within 5 minutes, says "I wouldn't mind if you groped me". We talked for 22 hours... he was more than turned on by us talking (something I find strange, I'm an ex he hasn't seen in 5 years and he's seeing a woman now). At one point late at night, we ended up making out and fooling around a bit (I didn't really want to, I knew it would bring back memories). He told me a few times "I love you"... something he can say when dating someone else but not when he was with me.

We said we wanted to be friends, and exchanged contact info.
After I left, we talked a few times on-line, then again nothing. He disappeared again, not communicating. I expected it, but didn't think it would be so quick.

His ex ironically continues to message me on gay.com, dating sites and other apps saying very nasty things about him and sometimes me. He stops for a few months, but then I get another message.

His ex thinks we got back together. I don't know where that idea came from, he's the one who told me he's doing a woman now.


I was just wondering...
Why would my ex be turned on by seeing me, I mean... he's the one who left and figured someone "closer to his own age" would be better to be with. Also, he's seeing a woman, and enjoys being with her. Why would he be aroused by me?

Also, why would his ex be insisting we got back together and are having sex. His messages are funny in a sick way (I do not respond to him), but he keeps thinking we're back together.

Its been almost 10 years since he and I met...and all the drama from his ex keep bringing up old wounds.

I guess I'm just looking to chat a bit. I was so happy when I was in this so-called relationship, and now I'm depressed. Each time I get another message its salt in the wound. I have my ex's tools from a project he failed on, and I plan to ship them to him. I don't think I can drop them off at his house, and the next best thing is to ship them.

Anybody else have such an experience?
Anybody want to chat for a bit?

title: Are you looking for a young, reliable roommate?
text:
My name is Scott Mildenberger. I'm a 25-year old illustrator from Boise, Idaho. I'm moving down to design for Holders, a clothing company out of San Jose, while I make coffee on the side and look for an illustrating position.

There's only one problem: I'm still looking for a place to live. I have about $4,000 saved while I get settled and start work, so rent won't be a problem. The reason I'm posting this ad in this particular section is because I'd simply rather live with another fellow homo.

Here's a little about me. I adore film, thrifting, puns, and all things pop culture. I'm also for the Oxford comma. I wish there were more to me, but there's really not. I know every Disney Animated Classic by heart (save for all the rubbish post-2000).

I think the last CD I bought was The Wedding Singer soundtrack because I couldn't believe I didn't already have it. Maybe it was Celine's A Decade of Song because I couldn't believe I didn't already have it. Regardless, this was a very long time ago.

Once, while at work, I took a chance to be a decent Samaritan and informed a gentleman holding a messy toddler that he had something on his forehead. "It's Ash Wednesday," he sighed. I was fucking mortified and a little annoyed that I finally had the opportunity to be of service to my fellow man (other than serving coffee, of course) and it completely backfired.

I'll have a cocktail a few times a week, and you bet your butt it will be a vodka soda every time. I drink my coffee black. I like to go running.

I've lived in my current apartment for almost four years and paid off my car last summer. What I'm trying to say is that I'm responsible and reliable.

My favorite smells are lipstick and puppy breath. My favorite films are (oh, God): Catwoman (2004 starring Halle Berry. . .loves it), Titanic, Burlesque (all hail Xtina), Aladdin, Meet Me in St. Louis, Steel Magnolias, A Home at the End of the World, Margot At the Wedding (can Nicole even do any wrong?), Devil and M. Night Shayamalan's The Village (best plot twist of all time, obvi). There are so many more, but, you know, there's no need to take up that much space. My favorite TV series are Nip/Tuck (Kimber for life), Six Feet Under (Brenda!), The Simple Life (loves it), and Seinfeld (I've seen every episode at least a dozen times. . .I know what you're thinking: "Get OUT!").

I thank Xtina for my life every day, but if you're more of a Britney fan, we'll agree to disagree. Substance conquers style, after all.

I'm kind of a night owl but get up early anyway. I'm clean and keep my fingernails trimmed and my unibrow separated. I'm pretty mellow and down to earth. Every time I leave San Francisco I get depressed for, like, weeks. I've realized that to be content, I need to permanently be in the place that makes me happy.

I don't know if any of this information is relevant as a potential roommate, or if you even bothered to read it (I understand it's a little sporadic), but I just wanted you to get a feel for me. I'm so ready to leave and start my life where I belong. If I seem like someone you'd like to get to know more (live with), or have any questions or concerns, contact me. Or point me in the right direction of someone who does. Feel free to text me any time, day or night.
show contact info


Looking forward to hearing from you,
Scott

(PS: I have a cat, Telly, a shorthaired Calico. She's clean, spayed, and behaves more like a dog [without the noise or the slobbering or the spazz]. She doesn't shed, loves people, especially males, cuddling and hanging out. She never hisses or meows or goes outside. You'll just love her.)

title: Considering moving there, looking for friends
text:
Hi everyone,
I'd like to first start off by saying that I don't currently live there. I reside for the time being in Honolulu, attending college and just putting this out there to see what's there. Too much drama, stress, and just plain bad memories in my life right now and looking to start fresh and to start doing things meaningful. Here looking for friends, opportunities, and experiences. Looking for people who are most compatible so please read the entire ad.
A little about me first. . ...white guy been on Hawaii for almost a decade. Originally from the east coast. Very shy to ppl initially until I warm up, then pretty talkative. Love to do most things, and enjoy teaching myself new skills. I'm more of a mix between a homebody and outdoorsy type. Love to experience nature and exploring new places. Hiking, running, hang glide, even cave exploring, open to new experiences. I also love to stay at home, "Netflix and chill", smoke 420, and chillax. Can be a huge nerd with video games at times. Going to college for an IT degree. Very fit and enjoy working out. (Workout buddies would be a huge motivation). Think I'd like to work myself up to a marathon one day just to see if I could do it. (Anybody interested?) I also enjoy eating healthy, I try to find a good balance within my diet. Love going to vegan and vegetarian restaurants. And even though this is essentially a platonic ad, people's lives still churn unpredictably. I'm still interested in meeting people mostly compatible. Sexually I'm bisexual and love all types of people regardless of gender and race. In my opinion, they're no more than a matter of perception. Furthermore, conventional marriage with one partner I view as societal oppression. A person and their partner should be allowed to be with whoever makes them happy so long as they're honest with themselves and everybody involved. (Anymore and I'll start to diverge from my main point of this ad. Just my thoughts and opinions, I'd be happy to discuss further with anyone.) 

About you, well I'm not looking for anyone in particular. A friend to go hiking with, running with, swimming with, out to eat with, play games with, hang out with etc etc etc. . ... I'm looking for lifelong connections with people. A family away from family. 
I'm extremely interested in meeting anyone working with non-profits and/or charity organizations. I'm looking to get involved in the community and bit more and do more good for the environment. Interested in starting my own non-profit organization and hoping to find someone with similar interests to bounce a few ideas off each other. My idea involves using web development, computer programming, and database management and any skills in these areas would be a major plus. Though, I'm going to school for these same areas and will be graduating end of this year, so it'll be fine regardless. Hoping to find people wanting to help people and the environment.
For any tech friends, I'd love to find people who's interested in pulling skills together to create things. I have experience in C# programming, PostgreSQL database, and pc management. Will have knowledge in HTML and Javascript by the end of the year.
Huge dog lover here, love all animals but dogs are my biggest weakness. You could say that sometimes I like dogs more than I like actual human beings. Anybody who works with animals (especially dogs) on a day to day basis I'd love to meet with you.

For the meantime, I'm essentially looking for a penpal I can talk to and get to know. When/if I end up moving to San Fran I'm hoping to be able to have a few friends over there so I'm not completely alone moving to a big city. Hoping to find someone who has something going for them and can provide me with a means to support myself (yes I'm looking to work for a living) but mostly looking for someone who's adventurous, outgoing, and friendly. People who live and love life!


Seeing as I'm posting this on CL I'd like to make this apparent that this isn't a sex ad and I'm not looking for any type of booty call initially. Anybody is free to respond and I'm open to all situations, just make your intentions clear in the first email. Please tell me a little about yourself and what we might have in common. I won't respond to any one lined responses as I don't feel like wasting my time. 

Looking for: m4w m4m m4mw m4t

title: Ideal friendship...different outcome. Read entire ad please :)
text:
Getting right to the point this is not facebook...so looking for just friends only here is not the #1 goal. I'm realistic so only respond to me if you can be realistic too. I know most guys online want that 'one thing' on everyone's mind. But I'm different. Honestly I want to take things to the sexual level I'm looking for with you first THEN mix friendship in, to make sure we click on that friendship level after hooking up. I do things my way, not the "normal" way. Try to follow along. Why meet for regular "dates" just to immediately assume that you don't click with someone only because you're so nervous? 

I like to have fun like most guys on these personals but I also like having deep conversations and making actual progress with someone along the way. So no I do not want what others want for their secret agendas; I want a guy that I can get to know a little first over the phone, go to your house to talk and hook up ON THE FIRST MEET, then be prepared to more than potentially have an on-going friendship with benefits if it's there. I'm more than capable of being real friends with real benefits, and am strongly looking for a guy who can be ready enough to follow my lead.

For hanging out I like movies, hiking, shopping, definitely clubbing, can do video games, walking around town, going out to local eateries to avoid fast-food and more. I'm 5'9 tall, masculine, average to thicker/stocky body build, short hair casual attire. Sometimes classy when going out but still masculine. I'm down to earth, funny, open-minded, outspoken, etc. Please be single and not currently attached to someone like your ex. Save the complications.

I do not send face pics, and I am not into judging looks or appearance. Too many people with fake pics and phony intentions, or robots who are simply pic collectors. We can talk on the phone, connect then just meet in person because I have nothing to hide so why try to stop at pictures? In fact I find that the best connections come from not having high expectations off of looks. Instead of being shallow, just be attracted to a personality, not a picture/looks. Race isn't important to me; however I do like being interracial whether it be friendship or more.... Clearly you should feel the same way. I only expect replies from guys who are open-minded about any race. In example, I love Latinos and Asians (yum) but if someone other than that is ringing my bell, then it is what it is :) For the record I'm a top looking for a submissive bttm to be down with who loves sex...and you be able host when we go further or for plan B in the car somewhere parked because I cannot host. Like under the stars chillin'.

Keeping in touch is key...We all have busy lives--you ARE NOT the only one with a busy schedule. If you say you want to meet, just fucking make the time for it and keep the plans. Or else stay the fuck offline. I cannot stress that enough. And back to pictures, it's annoying to exchange pictures with guys who can't follow through or keep the momentum going...if you're claiming to want even just a friend you should already have the time for them. By the way there's no sure way to tell if someone is a match on day 1. Real chemistry doesn't happen in 5 seconds, it happens over time after discovering there are general mutual interests. I want a guy who's prepared to meet with me a few different times before judging any chemistry.

The only real preference for FWB I have is age...I need a guy around my age who can keep up with me. So 18-29 hmu. But since it's a preference not a requirement, older guys feel free to be bold and hmu if you think we can still be good together :)

title: Is the m4w platonic section as creepy as it looks?
text:
This seems like a waste of time to look for a friend/companion. With all the guys looking to cuddle, massage or get one, sleep over, have sex right? All that is great. With the right person. don't get me wrong. If I found that person who could grow with me into that... Hell yes. OK I am hoping for a friend. Finding beyond that seems a bit unrealistic from here right now. 

I know where I have been. I know where I need to go. And I know I need to get there. It is time once again to change and reinvent. 

Here is my truth. I need to get in better shape. Both for health reasons and vanity. I need to go back to being more vain than the current not much at all. Aka self confident in my own skin. I also have a lot of things I need to accomplish. 

I have done this before. It is easier sometimes to motivate, and be motivated with others on a similar path. I want to do what I need to do. And maybe as part of getting ready it will be time to date, to find the right partner. Or a great friend. 

So if what I am saying has some sort of truth to you... Maybe we both can use some one to help get us get in shape, to motivate, to help, to encourage, to remind the other that they can, or they are... 

I don't have time to date, and I am not ready to date. I have time for a friend who I can be a positive influence. And one who can be the same for me. I don't have a specific age I am looking for. Though to need a reinvention. You won't be a teenager. Lol. I am a first generation new wave/ punk/ beginnings of MTV, tall guy, who has a full head of hair and looks younger. So if you can at least relate, that would be good. I am also a old/fastcar guy. 

I am not looking for a future life partner from this. Though if be some really weird set of circumstances... So, we can get in shape. Get prettied (is that a word) up. And get some stuff done. 

We can define what we are looking for in goals a day at a time. Or we can continue to go on paths we have chosen for ourselves. Its about moving forward. Wouldn't it be easier to accomplish with some help?

title: Therapy Group in SF for gay men over 50
text:
Get honest and caring support. 
Explore possibilities. 
Develop direction in your life.

I am a licensed clinical psychologist and have been leading therapy groups since the 1970s. There are one or two openings in the therapy/support group I lead on Thursday evenings in San Francisco, for gay men over 50. 

Issues discussed in the group include clarifying one's life goals; relationships with friends, family, and partners; finding meaning and connection; and the many other challenges of aging. The age range of the current group members is broad, from the late 50s through the 70s. The group meets every Thursday evening from 7:00 to 8:30 pm, in my office on Clement Street. There is a weekly fee.

I offer a no-cost in-person screening interview. 

Thank you!

title: 20s/30s Friends in the Sunset/Richmond
text:
I am just looking to meet some new friends in the Sunset or Richmond or nearby areas; it's just easier to meet up and go out. I've lost a lot of friends who have moved away or went to the East Bay so it's getting harder to retain consistent friends. This won't be limited to only hanging out in these neighborhoods as we can drive out or go wherever. It could be anything from taking a hike, playing/watching some sports, catching some live music as I love catching indie/alternative shows, going to an interesting event, going to movies, meeting at someone's home, grabbing a bite or even just meeting up for some company. Maybe you need to go to Target or Walmart and need to get out or feel like some company. I work downtown weekdays so most of my free time is night and weekends.

Anyways, please tell me a little about yourself and what you like to do. No need to send a pic as this is strictly platonic and I am one of the few on CL that seem to know what that means.

title: Craigslist's ONLY normal guy seeking a best friend :)
text:
A little about me, my name is Brian and I am 27 years old looking for a woman I can chat with, laugh with, and connect with on an intellectual level. I am a very normal guy with no ambitions to ask for naked pictures or trick you into anything dirty. I'm simply a lonely guy who moved from the midwest out here and I just miss having someone I can talk to and relate to. I am college educated with a Masters Degree and I have a full time job. 

I will be perfectly honest and say that I am currently married, however, my marriage has been lacking an emotional connection for a while now and I sometimes feel lost. If there is any woman out there experiencing the same feelings in her own relationship and would want to discuss ways to overcome the turbulence, I'd love to chat and maybe we can help each other through it. Everyone needs their, "person". I feel like I don't have one and I'd love to get to know you and build a strong friendship that any person so desperately needs in life. 

Please don't be intimidated to reply. I am open to chatting with anyone that needs a friend and I'm always willing to discuss whatever might be on your mind :) Have a great day and thank you for reading!!!

title: Seeking a SM, 50-70, Who Enjoys Impressionist Art and Visiting Museums
text:
Currently, there is a wonderful exhibit of Bonnard paintings at the Legion of Honor in S.F.
Do you admire and know his oeuvre?

He had a jewel-like palette and often created paintings of his wife at the breakfast table or taking a bath.
Almost always, Bonnard painted a pet cat or pet dog alongside his wife.

I love Impressionist painting and know a lot about Matisse, Pissarro, Bonnard and Monet.

If you're friendly, very well-educated and also a fan of Impressionist art - perhaps, we can visit the Bonnard exhibit together.

I am petite and very slender - with blue eyes and long dark hair.
Please send me your photo, a description of your interests and then I'll reciprocate.

It would be fun to get to know another art-lover.
** - tell me your age, in which city you live and something more about your interests.
Please Include your PHOTO!
Bonus points if you live/work on the Peninsula or South Bay!

Cheers!

title: CD, TV, TG? Free clothes and a Friend here.
text: Ok .... so you're thinking, "What's the catch? Free clothes for me???" Well, the answer is that there is no catch. I'm a forever cross dresser. Probably transgender, but too late for that. So just happily somewhere in-between. And ... I have more than a few things that I bought and then found them to be a bit too small for me. Let me explain. Even with a wig and a ton of makeup on, I still look like a tranny rather than a girl. And that doesn't allow me to just walk into Nordstroms and try on all their clothes. The little shop girls just get all confused. Reverses their polarity or something.You know? So I've bought things without trying them on (oh ...like they're for someone else?) and when I got home I guess I wasn't as "petite" as I thought I was! Damn! Actually, I'm 5'10" and 148 pounds, so if you're somewhat smaller, then most of these things should fit you just fine. The pics here are just some of the things I have to give away. Think of me as your "big sister" if you will. But .... and maybe there IS a catch in a way .... I'm not going to give this stuff away to just anyone. If I was going to do that, I'd just head off to Goodwill or something. No, I actually want to help some deserving soul out there. Someone who is a little gender bent like myself in one way or another. It's more than just cross dressing for me. It's really a part of who I am. And I think it's a very nice part. So if you just want to dress up to "be a slut" or because it's a guilty fetish, then you'll have to do it without my assistance. You'd probably just end up purging and it would all be wasted then. So maybe I'm looking for someone "normal" and happy with their feminine side? Something like that I guess. I don't look like a girl. I don't even try. I don't run around in skirts, but always girl jeans, girl tops and sweaters, and of course the proper attire that's next to your skin (very important, yes?). Hey, it makes me happy so there you go! If it makes you happy too (and you're well past 21), then write and introduce yourself. We're talking "platonic" here, so maybe we might become friends? Free clothes and a "girl" friend! Could be the start of something nice!

title: blogilates virtual peer pressure workout buddy
text:
Hello,
I respond better to peer pressure than setting my own goals with no one to benchmark/compete with, unfortunately. If you are the same and desire to incorporate a daily workout, I'm thinking we could exchange daily texts saying whether we've done the routine! and if one hasn't, encourage and egg the other on. We will be each other's cheerleader and comrade in arms. 

For simplicity, I would like us both to be completing the same routine. I'm thinking either the Blogilates beginners month workout calendar, or one of the sets on darebee.com. take a look and if you have another suggestion that is in a similar format, you can suggest it. We can be on different difficulty levels but it should be the same concept of a specific daily set that is doable at home. 

Where I'm at: female, in my mid-twenties, fit by average standards. I want to work on my stamina and strength. My focus is to build muscle and get stronger (hopefully leaner), not to lose weight. I don't enjoy jogging but I like tag games, bouldering, climbing trees and stuff. Need to get better at all of that. my arms and abs are weak.

If you are willing to be a dedicated peer pressure buddy and receive that kind of near-daily ( maybe not weekends.. haha) attention in turn, plz respond with a description about you. 

Also, I'm not ruling out meeting in person for jogging or something if we establish that kind of rapport. Friendship certainly also welcome. :-) And I mean Strictly Platonic.

Positive and healthy attitudes only, please. Maybe we're lazy and want to get to the point where we kick butt, but no body shaming or eating disorders on the way, k?

title: LGBTQ Gym - as featured in OUT Magazine
text:
The Perfect Sidekick (TPS) is the first LGBTQ gym in the country - providing tailored training for transgender clients preparing for gender-confirmation surgery. We were featured in OUT Magazine and the Advocate on the last week of March 2016. 

In addition to the overwhelming positive response from readers, we also realized that not enough people in the Bay Area are aware that there's a gym that provides a safe space for the LGBTQ community to workout without feelings discrimination.

We are currently offering a special: 6 Team Sessions + 2 Private Sessions for just $79. Come take a FREE tour!

What Makes Us an LGBT Gym?
-Provide tailored training for transgender clients preparing for gender-confirmation surgery
-Non-gender specific locker rooms
-Members are asked for their preferred gender pronoun at the beginning of every class
-Queer 101 Workshops: LGBTQ cultural sensitivity training for gym staff and members in the community
-Proactively partner with local LGBTQ organizations 

We are located at 2706 Park Blvd., Oakland, CA 94606 and can be reach at

title: Bucket List - Visit a nude beach or resort
text:
First off...yes, this is platonic. I'm not going to hit on you or stare.

Visiting a nude beach or a nudist resort is something that I've always wanted to try. The idea of being nude at a Northern California beach sounds very liberating. I just don't want to do this solo.

I don't have a strong preference on who goes with me. I'm about as non judgmental as people can get. I'm ok with just about any age, but prefer 21-45, any ethnicity and sexual orientation is fine, and don't worry about any possible body hang ups that you might have. I'm looking for good company. 

I'm 31, a Bay Area native, well traveled, I love the outdoors (rock climbing, marathon and trail running), and I am always up for an adventure. We can visit a local beach/resort or I'm willing to drive anywhere within a few hours from the Bay Area.

Hopefully we can plan a trip this weekend, but I'm open to other days as well.
